0.title: MP HC sees violent protests as lawyer kills self after pleading in court
0.article_body: Madhya Pradesh High Court witnessed violent protests by advocates as a lawyer allegedly died by suicide after pleading in the Jabalpur bench. Some policemen suffered injuries, Jabalpur SP said. The protesting lawyers allegedly vandalised courtrooms and set ablaze a senior advocate's office. This comes after the deceased allegedly had an altercation with a judge during a bail plea hearing.

1.title: 4 accused to be tried as adults in Hyderabad Jubilee Hills gangrape
1.article_body: Four of the five minors accused in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gangrape case will be tried as adults, said a Juvenile Justice Board on Friday. The accused had offered lift to a 17-year-old girl and then took turns raping her inside a car. The Principal Magistrate noted that the four minors were capable of understanding the consequences of their actions.

2.title: Gadkari asks Mercedes to produce affordable cars locally, says 'Even I can't afford them'
2.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged Mercedes-Benz to produce more cars locally and emphasised reducing costs. Speaking at the company's event, he said, "You increase the production, only then is it possible to reduce cost. We're middle-class people, even I can't afford your car." The company has launched EQS 580 4MATIC in India, its first locally assembled electric car.

3.title: 9 foreigners arrested as protests continue in Iran over Amini's death
3.article_body: Iran's Intelligence Ministry said on Friday that nine foreign nationals had been arrested in connection with the ongoing protests over the death of a 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini in police custody. The citizens from Germany, Poland, Italy, France, the Netherlands, Sweden and other countries were detained "during the riots or while plotting in the background", the ministry added.

4.title: Telangana CM KCR visits Yadadri temple, offers gold worth ₹52 lakh
4.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday visited the Sri Lakshminarasimha Swamy Temple in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district along with his family members. On Rao's behalf, his grandson offered a cheque of over ₹52 lakh to the temple as a donation for buying 1.16 kg of gold. The gold will be used for gold plating the "gopuram" at the temple.

5.title: Massive fire breaks out at Gurugram's Global Foyer Mall, several fire tenders rushed
5.article_body: A massive fire broke out at the Global Foyer Mall situated on the Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Saturday morning. The fire reportedly broke out on the first floor of the mall. Several fire tenders were rushed to the site and officials said that the fire has been brought under control. No casualties were reported in the incident.

6.title: North Korea fires 4th round of missile tests in 1 week
6.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Saturday, marking the fourth round of such a test in a week. South Korean military said it spotted the launches 18 minutes apart. Notably, amid North Korea's missile tests, the navies of South Korea, the US and Japan staged trilateral anti-submarine exercises on Friday for the first time in five years.

7.title: Introducing India’s first ever investment festival: ET Money
7.article_body: ET Money has launched the Great Indian Investment Festival that promises rewards worth ₹20 lakh for tax savings and investments. Users can get flat 60% off on Genius membership, up to ₹2 lakh of referral rewards and assured Amazon vouchers. Lucky draw winners will also get iPhone 14 Plus, iPad Air 5 and Royal Enfield Interceptor, said the brand.

8.title: Musk unveils prototype of Tesla's humanoid robot, to cost less than a car
8.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk unveiled a prototype of humanoid robot, dubbed 'Optimus', during the company's AI Day event on Saturday. During the event, the robot walked onstage, waved hello and danced. "The robot can actually do a lot more...We just didn't want it to fall on its face," said Musk, adding that it's expected to cost less than a car.

9.title: 6-year-old beaten to death for eating apple from 'prasad' in Bihar
9.article_body: A six-year-old boy was allegedly beaten to death for eating an apple from 'prasad' or offering meant for Goddess Durga at a school in Bihar's Gaya. "The owners of the school kept Vivek in a room and brutally assaulted him. After the physical assault, they threw him outside the premises," said the victim's grandfather. Police have arrested the accused.

10.title: Robinhood to close 5 more offices in US, no worker to be laid off
10.article_body: Robinhood Markets on Friday said it will partially or completely shut down five more offices in the US as part of its restructuring plan to cut expenses. The California-based brokerage company said the closures, which will result in restructuring charges of around $45 million, will be done without any job cuts. Robinhood fired around 23% of its employees in August.

11.title: No direct trains from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka Sec 21 on Sunday till 2 pm: DMRC
11.article_body: No direct Metro trains will be available from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka/Dwarka Sector-21 on Sunday till 2 PM due to track maintenance work between Yamuna Bank and Akshardham stations, DMRC said. "Train services...will be operated in two loops- regular services from Dwarka Sector-21 to Yamuna Bank in one loop...Yamuna Bank to Noida Electronic City in another loop," DMRC added.

12.title: Price of 19-kg LPG cylinder cut by ₹25.50, new price list for cities released
12.article_body: Oil marketing companies have announced a price cut of ₹25.50 for a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder with immediate effect. With the latest revision, the 19-kg LPG cylinder now costs ₹1,859 in Delhi, ₹1,959 in Kolkata, ₹1,811.50 in Mumbai and ₹2,009.50 in Chennai. Earlier in September, the cost of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was slashed by up to ₹100.

13.title: Intel's self-driving technology firm Mobileye files for IPO in US
13.article_body: Mobileye, an Intel-owned firm that makes chips and software for self-driving cars, has filed a prospectus in US to get listed on Nasdaq. While the prospectus didn't mention price range for the proposed listing, Bloomberg earlier reported that Intel expects the IPO to value Mobileye at up to $30 billion. Intel acquired the Israeli company in 2017 for $15.3 billion.

14.title: Will concrete every inch of Mumbai roads in 3 years: BMC Commissioner
14.article_body: The BMC Commissioner, Iqbal Chahal, informed the Bombay HC on Friday that within three years, every inch of Mumbai's roads, lanes and bylanes will be concreted. However, he added that Mumbai will not be pothole-free until the BMC becomes the single planning authority to look after maintenance work. The civic body also submitted a list of the 20 worst roads.

15.title: New COVID-19 cases drop below 100 in Bengaluru, no deaths reported
15.article_body: Bengaluru reported 93 new COVID-19 infections on Friday, taking the cumulative case count to 18,72,027, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,248, while the infection positivity rate stood at 1.18%.

16.title: Congress engages in appeasement politics: K'taka CM Bommai
16.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress leader Siddaramaiah for demanding a ban on the RSS, claiming that the Congress engages in appeasement politics. "Congress has no basis for asking why PFI has been banned because it was the same party that had withdrawn the cases booked against PFI...The RSS has built several institutions for the poor and downtrodden," said Bommai.

17.title: Preventive detention is a serious invasion of personal liberty: SC
17.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday observed that "preventive detention is a serious invasion of personal liberty". It said that due to this, whatever "little safeguards" the Constitution and law authorising the detention provides are of "utmost importance". The court made the observation while setting aside the preventive detention of a man under Prevention of Illicit Traffic in NDPS Act, 1988.

18.title: Mexican govt suffers major data hack; President's health issues revealed
18.article_body: The Mexican government on Friday said it had suffered a major cyber hack. The hack revealed personal details about Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's heart condition that led to his hospitalisation in January. According to media reports, the hack accessed six terabytes of data from the Defence Ministry, including information about criminal figures, and transcripts of communications.

19.title: PM Modi skips using mic to obey loudspeaker norms, apologises to Raj rally
19.article_body: PM Narendra Modi avoided using a microphone to address a rally in Rajasthan on Friday as he reached late and said he didn't want to violate rules by using microphones and loudspeakers after 10 pm. PM Modi said, "I reached a little late. Now it's 10 pm….I apologise for the delay...I want to promise you that I'll come here again."

20.title: US imposes first-ever sanction on Indian company for oil trade with Iran
20.article_body: The US imposed sanctions on Mumbai-based petrochemical trading company Tibalaji Petrochem Private Limited on Friday for carrying out oil trade with Iran. This marks the first time that such an action has been taken against an Indian company. Tibalaji purchased "millions of dollars' worth of" petrochemical products from Iran for "onward shipment to China", the US Department of Treasury said.

21.title: India reports 3,805 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 38,293
21.article_body: India reported 3,805 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 3,947 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in the country now stand at 38,293 following 5,069 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.29%.

22.title: I'm still friends with my exes, have very good relationship with them: Rashmika
22.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she is still friends with her exes. "I sort of like meet their families, their present, current, future, past, everything...But I have a very good relationship with them. So that's good," she added. She also reacted to rumours about her dating actor Vijay Deverakonda and called them "cute".

23.title: Thane mechanic gets donor heart in 4 days, discharged after 2 months
23.article_body: A Maharashtra state transport mechanic from Thane got a heart in 4 days after he was put on transplant list. The 39-year-old had suffered a heart attack which had damaged 70% of his heart. Reports said that the family of a 57-year-old brain-dead woman had agreed to donate her heart to him. He was discharged from hospital on September 30.

24.title: We are taking Putin's nuclear threats very seriously: US
24.article_body: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said that the US is taking Russian President Vladimir Putin's nuclear threats "very seriously". The US is communicating directly with Russia about the issue, including about decisive responses Washington would take if Moscow went down "that dark road", he added. Putin has warned Russia will use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is threatened.

25.title: Driver killed after tree falls on auto amid heavy rains in Pune
25.article_body: A 60-year-old autorickshaw driver was killed on Friday after a tree fell on his vehicle amid heavy rains in Pune, police said. The incident, which occurred around 4.30 pm, took place while the deceased was driving the autorickshaw, an inspector said. The fire brigade personnel were able to clear the tree to make way for traffic after two hours.

26.title: 25.76 grams of mephedrone worth ₹3.86 lakh seized in Pune, 3 arrested
26.article_body: Pune Police on Thursday arrested three men in possession of 25.76 grams of the banned drug mephedrone worth ₹3.86 lakh. The officials acted on a tip-off and arrested the accused on Shankar Sheth Road. Police also seized a two-wheeler and cell phones from them. Notably, police on Tuesday arrested two men and seized over 16 kg of opium poppy husk.

27.title: Babar Azam equals Virat Kohli's world record for being fastest to score 3,000 T20I runs
27.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has equalled former Team India captain Virat Kohli's world record for being the fastest batter to score 3,000 runs in T20I cricket. Babar reached the 3,000-run mark during his knock of 87*(59) against England in the sixth T20I. The 27-year-old took 81 innings to reach the milestone. Kohli had also taken 81 innings.

28.title: Meat shops, slaughterhouses to be shut on Gandhi Jayanti in Hyderabad
28.article_body: All meat shops will remain closed in Hyderabad on October 2 on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti, the civic body has said. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has also ordered all sheep, goat and cow slaughterhouses to be shut that day. The 153rd birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi will be celebrated across the country on Sunday.

29.title: Gates congratulates 13-year-old bridge champion Anshul, says 'Amazed by his skill'
29.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates congratulated Anshul Bhatt, a 13-year-old from Mumbai, who became the youngest winner at the World Youth Bridge Championship in Italy last month. "I'm amazed by...Bhatt's concentration and skill...his ability to win at Bridge on the world stage," wrote Gates on LinkedIn. In a tweet, the world's fifth-richest person also referred to bridge as his "favourite pastime".

30.title: Man dies of heart attack after getting eviction notice in Ghaziabad
30.article_body: A man from Ghaziabad suffered a heart attack and died allegedly after the civic body's officials pasted an eviction notice on his house a few days ago. The notice stated that the house is dilapidated and occupants should vacate it immediately, Hindustan Times reported. A councillor said that the family is poor and he'll raise the issue before corporation officials.

31.title: India abstains from UNSC vote against Russia's 'illegal referenda' in Ukraine
31.article_body: India abstained on a draft resolution at the UN Security Council condemning Russia's "illegal referenda" and annexation of four Ukrainian territories. While 10 nations voted for the resolution, India, China, Gabon, and Brazil abstained. India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Ambassador Ruchira Kamboj, said, "We urge that all efforts are made...for...cessation of violence and hostilities."

32.title: 15 major projects stalled as Delhi govt yet to give permission: LG to CM
32.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal stating that fifteen major projects involving the felling of trees and translocation are stalled as the government is yet to give permission. "Such unwarranted delays...leading to a waste of public funds due to time and cost overruns of the projects for which accountability needs to be fixed," LG added.

33.title: Total ban on sale of meat on Gandhi Jayanti in Bengaluru: BBMP
33.article_body: There will be a total ban on sale of meat and slaughter of animals on October 2 on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti in Bengaluru, civic body BBMP has said. The 153rd birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi will be celebrated across the country that day. BBMP had previously announced a similar ban on Ganesh Chaturthi on August 31.

34.title: BMC to fix 21 worst-affected Mumbai roads in 3 months, ₹228.49 cr allocated
34.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has informed the Bombay high court (HC) that it will concretise 21 worst-affected roads in Mumbai in three months. ₹228.49 crore have been allocated for the work. ₹140.2 crore have been allocated to the western suburbs. Meanwhile, ₹47 crore has been allocated for the concretisation of the 7.2-kilometre stretch of Aarey Road.

35.title: Musk expected to unveil 1st prototype of Tesla's humanoid robot Optimus
35.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is expected to provide a new look at its humanoid robot, Optimus, at Tesla AI Day on Friday. Musk announced Tesla's plan for humanoid robots at AI Day in August 2021 and delayed this year's event to have its robot prototype working. Ahead of the event, Tesla unveiled the robot's hands in a tweet.

36.title: Ex-J'khand minister KN Tripathi files nomination for Cong Prez poll
36.article_body: Former Jharkhand minister KN Tripathi on Friday submitted his nomination papers for the Congress President election. Tripathi handed over the nomination papers to Madhusudan Mistry, Chairman of the Congress' Central Election Authority. Tripathi, a former MLA, has also served in the Indian Air Force. Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge have also filed their nomination papers for the election.

37.title: Gas leaks from ONGC well in Guj; people complain of eye, throat irritation
37.article_body: Several people in Kasalpura village have complained of burning sensation in their eyes and throat after gas leaked from a well of the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) in Gujarat's Mahesana on Friday, the District Development Officer said. "Compressed air that is pumped into the well has been escaping, and the gas is not poisonous or inflammable," he added.

38.title: 15 diamonds worth ₹1 crore mined in Panna in 2 days
38.article_body: As many as 15 diamonds were mined by people in the last two days in the shallow mines of Panna in Bundelkhand region of Madhya Pradesh. The stones collectively weigh a total of 35.86 carat and will fetch around ₹1 crore during the official auction, an official said. A man named Dukman Ahirwar found six diamonds out of the 15.

39.title: Three-person panel to look into Carlsen-Niemann cheating scandal
39.article_body: The International Chess Federation (FIDE) said a three-person panel will look into world champion Magnus Carlsen's allegations that American player Hans Niemann cheated during their match. "The panel will ensure a fair ruling, protecting the rights of both parties," said the federation. Carlsen had withdrawn from the Sinquefield Cup earlier this month after losing to 19-year-old Niemann.

40.title: Red Bull, Aston Martin exceeded 2021 F1 budget cap angering Ferrari: Report
40.article_body: Red Bull and Aston Martin are two F1 teams that have reportedly exceeded the 2021 budget cap. The report says violations up to $5 million are a 'minor rule violation' and the perpetrators "may get away with a fine". Ferrari is reportedly angry as the extra money "can be worth up to half a second on the race track".

41.title: Unseeded Indian pair Rohan-Sikki enter Vietnam Open mixed doubles semis
41.article_body: Indian mixed doubles pair of Rohan Kapoor and Sikki Reddy entered the semi-final at the Vietnam Open Super 100 tournament on Friday. The unseeded Indian duo beat third seeds Chan Peng Soon and Cheah Yee See of Malaysia 21-19, 21-17 in the quarter-final. They will face top seeds Rehan Naufal Kusharjanto and Lisa Ayu Kusumawati of Indonesia in the semi-final.

42.title: Happy on winning gold medal at 36th National Games: Weightlifter Mirabai
42.article_body: After winning a gold medal at 36th National Games in Gujarat, Olympic silver medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu tweeted, "Happy on winning [the] gold medal." Mirabai, representing Manipur, won the gold with a total lift of 191 kg. She lifted 84 kg in snatch event and 107 kg in the clean and jerk event in the women's 49-kg category on Friday.

43.title: Ind team to fly to Aus ahead of T20 WC to attend special preparation camp
43.article_body: The Indian cricket team is reportedly expected to fly to Australia ahead of the ICC T20 World Cup to attend a special preparation camp. According to ESPNcricinfo, the team will go on October 6, two days after the T20I series against South Africa gets over. India is likely to train at the camp till October 13.

44.title: Chile, Peru approach CAS to bar Ecuador from 2022 FIFA World Cup
44.article_body: Chile and Peru have both appealed to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) to bar Ecuador from the 2022 FIFA World Cup. In September, FIFA had ruled for Ecuador in a dispute over defender Byron Castillo's nationality. Chile said there is "countless proof" that Castillo was born in Colombia in July 1995 and not in Ecuador in November 1998.

45.title: Have to coach and back him; I believe in him: Man Utd's Ten Hag on Maguire
45.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said he's "really convinced" club captain Harry Maguire will improve his form. "I have to coach him and back him. I back him because I believe in him," said Ten Hag. Adding that the player was "really good" in pre-season, Ten Hag attributed Maguire being dropped to the "good performance" of the other centre-backs.

46.title: Nitish doesn't want to be PM, opp'n unity his only agenda: Tejashwi
46.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said CM Nitish Kumar's "only agenda...right now is bringing all opposition together". "Nitish Kumar is the Chief Minister and we are working under his guidance...He has no desire to become the PM," added Tejashwi. Kumar has been making appearances with other opposition leaders to possibly create a united front for the 2024 Lok Sabha Elections.

47.title: BJP-JJP govt in Haryana pushing youth into unemployment: Cong's Hooda
47.article_body: Congress' Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Friday alleged that the BJP-JJP government in Haryana is pushing the youth into the quagmire of unemployment. Expressing concern over the "appalling unemployment" in the state, Hooda said, "On one hand, Haryana is facing an unemployment rate of 37.3%, the highest in the country, and on the other, 1.82 lakh posts are...vacant in government departments."

48.title: Clear obstructions in front of Vizhinjam Port: HC to Kerala govt
48.article_body: The Kerala High Court (HC) asked the state government on Friday to clear obstructions put up by protesters in front of the Vizhinjam Port, which is being built by Adani Ports. The coastal people are demanding an impact study be done on the multi-crore project. Adani Ports had moved the court on August 25, seeking protection from the protesters.

49.title: Court not a place for publicity: SC on rejecting plea against EVMs
49.article_body: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea which claimed electronic voting machines (EVMs) were "controlled" by companies and not the Election Commission. "It (the court) is not a place where everybody walks in just to get some publicity," said the bench. The SC also stated that the petitioner, Madhya Pradesh Jan Vikas Party, is seeking "to get recognition by filing petitions".

50.title: 18-yr-old woman going for garba chased, molested by man in Gujarat
50.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly chased and molested an 18-year-old woman in Gujarat's Gandhinagar when she was going to a garba venue on Tuesday night. She claimed the man tore her clothes in a bid to rape her. The venue was reportedly located near her house. The accused escaped from the scene after the woman's brother arrived upon hearing her scream.

51.title: Mother-daughter duo killed in road accident in UP
51.article_body: A mother-daughter duo was killed after the motorcycle on which they were travelling was hit by a truck from behind on a national highway in Fatehpur, UP. The deceased, Pooja (25) and her daughter Anshika (3), were being taken by Pooja's brother, Santosh Kumar, to the former's in-laws' place, police said. Notably, the accused truck driver is absconding.

52.title: 7 arrested for killing Odisha tribal man on suspicion of sorcery
52.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on Friday for allegedly killing a 33-year-old tribal man on suspicion of him practising black magic, an officer said. Pandu Munda, the 33-year-old deceased, belonged to Kothabila village. Munda's wife had told the police on Pandu being missing since September 17.

53.title: Zakir Naik's staffer acquitted of radicalisation charges
53.article_body: A special NIA court acquitted Arshi Qureshi, a manager of the Islamic Research Foundation, whose President Zakir Naik was arrested in 2016 on charges of radicalising youngsters. The acquittal came due to a lack of cogent evidence. A 4,000-page chargesheet was filed against Qureshi. He was arrested, along with two others, for allegedly radicalising 22 Muslim youths to join ISIS.

54.title: UP couple die by suicide after harassment despite paying back lenders
54.article_body: A couple in UP's Shahjahanpur died by suicide after allegedly being harassed by money lenders. A suicide note alleges that although the couple paid back their two loans of ₹1 lakh and ₹1.5 lakh with interest, the lenders were pressuring them to take more loans. Police said prima facie it appears the man strangulated his wife and then hanged himself.

55.title: Govt approves release of ₹488 cr disaster fund to UP, Punjab & Goa
55.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday approved the release of ₹488 crore to Uttar Pradesh, Punjab and Goa under the State Disaster Mitigation Fund (SDMF) for the year 2021-22. The money is to be used for undertaking mitigation activities to reduce the risks from disasters. The Centre has allocated ₹32,031 crore for the SDMF for the years 2021-22 to 2025-26.

56.title: Gunfire, explosions heard near Presidential Palace in Burkina Faso
56.article_body: Heavy gunfire and a large explosion were heard near the Presidential Palace and the military junta's headquarters in Ouagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso, on Friday, giving rise to speculation of a mutiny. Troops were deployed on the major road junctions in the city. Military leader Paul-Henri Damiba has accused some army units of creating a "confused situation".

57.title: Great deal of history will be written in the Indo-Pacific: Biden
57.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "a great deal" of the world's history will be written in the Indo-Pacific in the coming decades. Biden made the comments as he addressed leaders of over a dozen Pacific Island nations in Washington on Thursday. "The security of America...depends on your security and the security of the Pacific," Biden told the visiting leaders.

58.title: Sri Lanka recorded 69.8% inflation in September 2022
58.article_body: Sri Lanka’s inflation hit a record high of 69.8% in September this year, the Colombo Consumer Price Index said on Friday. In August, the country recorded inflation of 64.3%. Sri Lanka is presently experiencing an extreme economic crisis, which has resulted in an acute shortage of essential items like food and medicines.

59.title: Pak PM's House 'debugged': Officials after last week’s audio leaks
59.article_body: A top Pakistani panel has completed combing and debugging the Prime Minister's House in the Islamabad Capital Territory on Friday, officials said. Purported audio clips of Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif speaking with Principal Secretary Tauqeer Shah surfaced online last week. Earlier this week, former Prime Minister Imran Khan's audio clips were also leaked online.

60.title: India-made loitering munition successfully tested in Pokhran: Report
60.article_body: An indigenous loitering munition developed by Tata Advanced Systems Limited successfully struck its targets during tests at Pokhran, said a report. The system, called ALS 50, is designed for Vertical Take Off and Landing (VTOL) and will reportedly soon be inducted into the armed forces. The bomb-carrying drone reportedly has a range of 1,000 km and a 23-kg load-carrying capacity.

61.title: John Cena sets Guinness record for most wishes granted through Make-A-Wish Foundation
61.article_body: WWE star John Cena has entered the Guinness Book of World Records for granting the most wishes through the Make-A-Wish Foundation. Cena has granted 650 wishes so far, while no other personality has granted more than 200 wishes. Make-A-Wish Foundation is a non-profit organisation through which children with a critical illness can have one of their feasible wishes fulfilled.

62.title: WADA refuses to remove marijuana from list of banned substances
62.article_body: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) kept marijuana on its list of banned substances as the body rejected calls for change. World Athletics chief Sebastian Coe was among those who supported changing the status following sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson missing the Olympics after testing positive. WADA said removing marijuana from the list was "not supported by the experts' thorough review".

63.title: Bihar nursing home allegedly removes both kidneys of a woman
63.article_body: The Bihar Police has formed three special teams to nab the doctor and owner of a private nursing home for allegedly removing both the kidneys of a woman. The incident reportedly took place when the victim underwent a uterus-removal surgery. Doctors of a state-run hospital said more tests were needed to confirm if both her kidneys have been removed.

64.title: Indian-origin UK minister Braverman wins 1st Queen Elizabeth II award
64.article_body: UK's Indian-origin Home Secretary Suella Braverman has become the first-ever recipient of the Queen Elizabeth II Woman of the Year award. The 42-year-old Cabinet member said the award was the "honour of her life". "My mum and dad came to this country from Kenya and Mauritius in the 1960s," she said in a pre-recorded message for the award ceremony.

65.title: As a team, we are not going to analyse too much: Rohit on Bumrah
65.article_body: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma commented after pacer Jasprit Bumrah returned from an injury to the playing XI after a gap of over two months. "The back injury can be tricky. I am not going to talk too much about how he bowled...We are not going to analyse too much. Just want him to come and enjoy," Rohit said.

66.title: '21 TMC MLAs are in touch with me,' Mithun Chakraborty reiterates
66.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty on Saturday reiterated that 21 Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLAs are directly in touch with him. The actor-turned-politician said he is well aware of objections within BJP to inducting TMC leaders. "Many leaders have said that [BJP] won't take rotten potatoes," he added. TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh said, "TMC MLAs aren't up for sale."

67.title: Delhi records 71 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 0.81%
67.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported 71 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 0.81%, as per the city health department. No deaths were recorded due to the infection in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 403, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi had recorded 95 cases of the viral disease on Friday.

68.title: Egypt to bid for hosting 2036 Olympic Games: Sports Minister
68.article_body: Egyptian Sports Minister Ashraf Sobhi said that the country will apply to host the Summer Olympic Games in 2036. A statement, issued by the Egyptian cabinet, quoted IOC President Thomas Bach as saying Egypt's sports infrastructure was capable of hosting the event. Notably, if the bid turns successful then Egypt will become the first African nation to host the event.

69.title: Digvijaya Singh gets bail in defamation case over comment on RSS
69.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Saturday was granted bail in a defamation case over his claim that people associated with Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) were receiving money from Pakistani spy agency Inter-Services Intelligence. He was granted bail on a personal bond of ₹50,000. Following the bail, Singh said that as RSS wasn't a registered organisation, it couldn't be defamed.

70.title: Death toll from migrant boat capsize off Syria reaches 94
70.article_body: The death toll from a migrant boat capsize earlier this week off the Syrian coast has climbed to 94, the Syrian state media said on Saturday. The rise in death toll comes as more bodies were recovered by Syrian authorities in an operation that began on Thursday afternoon, state media reported. The migrant boat had reportedly set sail from Lebanon.

71.title: I was not copybook style: MS Dhoni on his wicketkeeping style
71.article_body: Talking about his wicketkeeping style, former India captain MS Dhoni said that he was not copybook style. Talking about Kiran More helping him out initially, Dhoni added, "He helped me a lot with my keeping, with my drills. What I really liked was, he understood my wicketkeeping technique was unique."

72.title: Japan to welcome back foreign tourists from October 11
72.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida has said his country will welcome back tourists from October 11 this year, after an over two-year-long coronavirus-forced travel suspension. "Finally, Japan will reopen the border...visa waiver is back, no daily limit and free individual visits," Japanese Digital Minister Taro Kono tweeted. Japan suspended its visa programme in March 2020 after the COVID-19 outbreak.

73.title: India create history in Jhulan's last match, whitewash England in ODIs at their home
73.article_body: India created history on Saturday by completing a women's ODI series whitewash against England on England soil for the first time ever. India defeated England by 16 runs in the third ODI. India were bowled out for 169 runs, while England were dismissed for 153 runs. Jhulan Goswami, who was featuring in her last international match, took two wickets.

74.title: Hope to make hockey World Cup debut in Odisha next year: Abhishek
74.article_body: Indian men's hockey team forward Abhishek, who was part of India's silver medal-winning team at Commonwealth Games 2022, said he hopes he can make his World Cup debut in Odisha in January next year. "And I hope to make it a pleasant memory as well. It'll be a lot of fun in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela at...World Cup 2023," he added.

75.title: 730 detained in anti-mobilisation protests across Russia: Rights group
75.article_body: At least 730 people were detained across Russia on Saturday at protests against Kremlin's military mobilisation order, a rights group cited by Reuters said. The OVD-Info protest monitoring group said it was aware of detentions in 32 different cities. Earlier this week, President Vladimir Putin ordered Russia's first military draft since World War 2 for the conflict in Ukraine.

76.title: 2021 US Open champion Raducanu retires from semi-final in Korea
76.article_body: World number 77 Emma Raducanu was forced to retire from the Hana Bank Korea Open semi-final against Jelena Ostapenko on Saturday due to a left glute injury. The 19-year-old, who was playing in her first semi-final since winning US Open last year, was down 4-6, 6-3, 3-0 when she retired. Top seed Ostapenko will face Ekaterina Alexandrova in Sunday's final.

77.title: Cong in Karnataka is united, BJP engaged in propaganda war: Khader
77.article_body: Congress MLA UT Khader said that the Karnataka unit of the party is united and the ruling BJP is engaged in a propaganda war. Senior state Congress leaders, DK Shivakumar and Siddaramaiah, are having a cordial relationship, Khader said. He added that the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is aimed at building bonds of friendship among the people of all states.

78.title: Half of judiciary's issues are state-sponsored litigations: Ex-CJI
78.article_body: Former CJI NV Ramana said half of the judiciary's problems would be resolved if the government puts a halt to state-sponsored litigations. "Inter-departmental disputes, service matters and those relating to the inaction of authorities clogging the system are appalling," said Ramana. He added that the judicial infrastructure in the country even after 75 years of independence was 'disturbing'.

79.title: I was about to vomit: Falguni on remixed version of her song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai'
79.article_body: Talking about her first reaction to the remixed version of her song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai' sung by Neha Kakkar, Falguni Pathak said, "I was about to vomit." She added, "The video and picturization had such innocence but they have ruined it." She further said, "If you want to reach out to...younger generation, change...rhythm of...song, but don’t make it cheap."

80.title: Woman gets her husband married to his ex-lover in Andhra, trio to live together
80.article_body: A woman in Andhra Pradesh officiated the wedding of her husband with his former partner in a traditional ceremony at a temple in Tirupati. Kalyan, who was married to Vimala, came in contact with his ex Nitya Sree recently and Kalyan and Nitya convinced Vimala to agree to their marriage. The trio will reportedly live together in the same house.

81.title: Jhulan gets guard of honour by England players in last match of her career, video viral
81.article_body: India pacer Jhulan Goswami got a guard of honour by England players while coming out to bat in last match of her career. England Cricket tweeted, "For over 20 years Jhulan has run in...hit a length and blazed a trail...She has bowled nearly 10,000 balls in ODIs...and she may just have inspired as many young girls to try cricket."

82.title: Won't ever comment on Verstappen's driving or personality: Hamilton
82.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton refused to speak about current world champion Max Verstappen's personality and driving. "I won't ever comment on either of those," said Hamilton when asked during a video wherein other F1 drivers spoke highly of Verstappen. Recently, Red Bull team principal Christian Horner accused Hamilton of "never once" recognising "Max's ability".

83.title: 3, including 2 Iranian tourists, injured in road accident in UP
83.article_body: Three persons, including two Iranian tourists, were injured when the mini-bus they were travelling in rammed into a vehicle ahead of it on Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, police said. The injured were identified as 35-year-old Aafia and 30-year-old Ilhan. There were 17 foreign tourists who were going to Agra to visit the Taj Mahal and other monuments.

84.title: Activists stage protest against Kerala dog killings at Delhi's Jantar Mantar
84.article_body: Animal rights activists, including several children and youths, staged a peaceful protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar on Saturday against killing of street dogs in Kerala. They alleged that despite Supreme Court's orders to protect dogs, they are being killed mercilessly. Several cases of dogs being poisoned, beaten, and burned alive amid rising dog bite incidents in Kerala have come up.

85.title: Bids invited for bullet train project tunnel passing under sea
85.article_body: The National High Speed Rail Corporation has invited bids for constructing a 21-km underground tunnel as part of the Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project. A 7-km stretch of the tunnel will be constructed under the sea, making it a complex engineering work. This is the third time bids are being invited for the project after failed attempts in 2019 and 2021.

86.title: Video of 'Shaka Laka...' actor shooting with magic pencil surfaces, fans react
86.article_body: A video of 'Shaka Laka Boom Boom' actor Kinshuk Vaidya filming with the 'magic pencil' from the show has surfaced online. In the video, shared by photographer Viral Bhayani, Kinshuk could be seen trying to bring something to life with the pencil. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Childhood memories," while another commented, "Ohh my god...is it coming again??"

87.title: Power gone into heads of BJP leaders: AAP MLA on Ankita murder case
87.article_body: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj has called the murder of 19-year-old Ankita Bhandari an extremely shameful act. BJP leader Vinod Arya's son has been arrested in the case. Bharadwaj claimed the murder was the result of power going into BJP leaders' heads. "BJP is so intoxicated in power that even a small [BJP] leader...believes that he rules the country," he added.

88.title: India & other Quad nations commit to expanding UN Security Council
88.article_body: The Quadrilateral Security Dialogue or Quad has committed to expanding the permanent and non-permanent seats of the UN Security Council (UNSC). In a joint statement, the Foreign Ministers of India, Japan, Australia and the US said reforming the world body would help reflect the "current global realities". Earlier, US President Joe Biden said the UNSC should be reformed.

89.title: KRK says he will quit reviewing films after 'Vikram Vedha'
89.article_body: Actor and film critic Kamaal Rashid Khan aka KRK tweeted on Saturday that he'll not be reviewing films after 'Vikram Vedha'. "Thanks to all...Bollywood people...for not accepting me as...critic but filing so many cases against me to stop my reviews," he added. KRK was arrested over derogatory tweet and molestation cases on August 30. He was later released on bail.

90.title: Indian football team held to 1-1 draw by lower ranked Singapore
90.article_body: Indian men's football team played out a 1-1 draw with Singapore at the Hung Thinh Friendly Football Tournament in Vietnam. Singapore, the 159th ranked team, opened the scoring in the 37th minute as India hit back with an Ashique Kuruniyan equaliser six minutes later. "There are many things that we could have done better," said Sunil Chhetri after the match.

91.title: Indian partition was irrational, done in hurry: Ram Madhav
91.article_body: RSS leader Ram Madhav said that the partition of India, which led to the creation of Pakistan, was irrational and was done in a hurry. "Mahatma Gandhi may not be fully absolved of the sequence of events ending in the tragic partition...but it will be unfair to blame one man who represented many lofty ideals and inspired generations," Madhav said.

92.title: Piyush Goyal discusses bilateral ties with Singaporean minister
92.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal met Tharman Shanmugaratnam, Singapore Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies, during his visit to the island nation on Saturday. "Discussed strengthening bilateral cooperation across several areas of mutual interest," Goyal tweeted. Later, Goyal held a roundtable with business executives and investors.

93.title: One more arrested in Amritsar IED case for arranging motorcycle
93.article_body: One more person was arrested for his alleged involvement in planting an IED under the car of a Punjab Police sub-inspector in Amritsar, police said on Saturday. The arrested man has been identified as Satnam Singh alias Honey. He is suspected of providing a motorcycle to the accused person who was arrested earlier for planting the explosive device, police added.

94.title: Kejriwal, Mann to visit Ahmedabad tomorrow ahead of Gujarat polls
94.article_body: Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders Arvind Kejriwal and Bhagwant Mann will visit Ahmedabad on Sunday in preparation for the Gujarat elections. “Will interact with youth, safai karamcharis and temporary employees there. Every section of Gujarat considers the Aam Aadmi Party as their hope,” Kejriwal tweeted. Ahead of the assembly polls, Kejriwal has been travelling to the state every week.

95.title: Iran planning 'proportional' response to Ukraine downgrading ties
95.article_body: Iran is planning a "proportional" response to Ukraine downgrading ties with the country over "unconfirmed reports" of drone sales to Russia, Tehran said on Saturday. Kyiv on Friday said that it would revoke the Iranian ambassador's accreditation over Tehran's decision to supply Russian forces with drones. The staff strength at the Iranian embassy would also be significantly downsized, Kyiv added.

96.title: Pant is a predetermined, premeditated cricketer: Gavaskar
96.article_body: Former Indian skipper Sunil Gavaskar said that wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant needs to develop his "off-side game". "Pant is a predetermined, premeditated cricketer. He decides quite often what he is going to do before the ball is bowled," Gavaskar said. "That's why he gets into trouble as he looks for something which is not there," the 73-year-old former cricketer added.

97.title: BJP appoints Shiv Bakshi as Parliamentary Party Office Secretary
97.article_body: The BJP has appointed Shiv Shakti Nath Bakshi as the party's new Parliamentary Party Office Secretary. BJP General Secretary and Headquarters In-charge Arun Singh passed an order with regard to the appointment. Bakshi is the current National Convenor of the BJP Journals and Publication Department. He is also the Executive Editor of BJP's mouthpiece Kamal Sandesh.

98.title: Divisive & communal organisations should be banned: Maha Cong Prez
98.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Saturday demanded a ban on Popular Front of India (PFI), which is under the scanner for allegedly supporting terror activities. "Divisive and communal organisations should be banned. The Congress wants peace and such tendencies to create a divide should be stopped," he said. Patole criticised the alleged raising of 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans in Pune.

99.title: School principal shot at by Class 12 student in UP; critical
99.article_body: A Class 12 student of Adarsh Ramswaroop Inter College in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district allegedly shot at the school's principal on the campus on Saturday. The 48-year-old principal, who was shot twice in the stomach, is stated to be in a critical condition. Police said the shooting came a day after the victim scolded two Class 12 students for fighting.

100.title: They're trying to make me a prostitute: U'khand resort receptionist texted friend
100.article_body: Uttarakhand resort receptionist Ankita Bhandari had sent her friend a text message, before her death, saying, "They are trying to turn me into a prostitute." Bhandari was working at a resort owned by ex-BJP leader Vinod Arya's son Pulkit, who's been accused of murdering her. She reportedly alleged she was being forced to provide "special services" to guests for ₹10,000.

101.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till September 27, list released
101.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued a heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs till September 27. Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura may witness heavy rainfall across the next three days. Odisha may witness heavy rainfall on September 27. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is expected over Himachal Pradesh, Bihar, Uttarakhand, West Bengal and Sikkim on September 25.

102.title: Will present world-class VFX in 'Krrish 4': Rakesh Roshan
102.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said to compete with Hollywood, he has no choice but to present world-class VFX in 'Krrish 4'. "They've been using VFX for so many years. So their way of working, understanding is faster and so is their visualisation," he said. He also promised to treat the audience with a lot of special effects in 'Krrish 4'.

103.title: We're trying to be a bit more aggressive upfront: Aaron Finch
103.article_body: After losing the second T20I to India on Friday, Australian captain Aaron Finch said that their side is trying to play with an aggressive approach. "It's important that you're always looking at ways to improve and obviously, we went with [Glenn] Maxwell at three, Tim David at four, so we're trying to be a bit more aggressive upfront," Finch said.

104.title: Arsenal have good chance to win Premier League this season: Ex-manager Wenger
104.article_body: Former manager Arsene Wenger has said Arsenal have a "good chance" to win the Premier League title this season in the absence of a "super dominating" team. With 18 points from opening seven matches of the season, Arsenal are currently on top of the standings. Both defending champions Manchester City and Tottenham Hotspur are one point behind Arsenal.

105.title: 2 labourers from Bihar injured after terrorists open fire in J&K's Pulwama
105.article_body: Two labourers from Bihar suffered injuries after terrorists opened fire on them in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Saturday evening. Police said the labourers have been shifted to a hospital, where their condition is stated to be stable. As per reports, the incident took place in the Ratnipora area of Pulwama.

106.title: Broad reacts to pic of Federer, Nadal crying, says 'Me, when Jimmy retires in 2053'
106.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to his Instagram Stories to react to the picture of Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal crying after Federer's last-ever professional match. "Me, when Jimmy (James Anderson) retires in 2053," he wrote. Federer played his last tennis match by teaming up with Rafael Nadal for a doubles match in Laver Cup.

107.title: J’khand CM’s aide ran illegal mining operation worth ₹1,000 cr: ED
107.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has told the PMLA Court in Ranchi that CM Hemant Soren’s MLA representative Pankaj Mishra was managing an illegal mining operation worth over ₹1,000 crore in Jharkhand’s Sahibganj district and adjacent areas. The ED has named Mishra and his associates Bacchu Yadav and Prem Prakash as accused. All the accused are in judicial custody.

108.title: CBI arrests ex-Mumbai Police chief in NSE phone tapping case
108.article_body: The CBI on Saturday arrested former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey after a Delhi court granted a four-day remand of Pandey to the probe agency in connection with the National Stock Exchange (NSE) phone tapping case. It is alleged that Pandey's company iSec Services Private Limited, along with others, illegally intercepted and recorded calls by various NSE officials from 2009-2017.

109.title: Axar Patel can bowl in any stage, gives advantage: Rohit Sharma
109.article_body: After Indian spinner Axar Patel picked up two wickets against Australia in the 2nd T20I on Friday, skipper Rohit Sharma spoke about the importance of the 28-year-old bowler in the team. "Axar can bowl in any stage, which gives me an advantage of using the other bowlers in different situations too...maybe use the pacers in the middle overs," Rohit said.

110.title: Harmeet Desai wins men's singles TT title at National Games
110.article_body: Table tennis player Harmeet Desai beat Soumyajit Ghosh 11-8, 11-4, 11-7, 11-8 to win men's singles title at 36th National Games in Surat on Saturday. "My goal is to be...top-ranked Indian player while also entering the top-50 of world rankings," said Desai. The 29-year-old is currently ranked 124th in the world, while Sathiyan Gnanasekaran is the top-ranked Indian at 37.

111.title: Premeditated: CM on violence during PFI's hartal in Kerala
111.article_body: Kerala witnessed premeditated violence during the hartal led by the Popular Front of India (PFI) on Friday, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said on Saturday. Stating that it was an attempt to destroy the peaceful atmosphere of the state, Vijayan added that the culprits will not be spared. He noted that the violence resulted in destruction of public and private properties.

112.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Gorkha' to go on floors in 2023: Reports
112.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Gorkha' will reportedly go on the floors next year. According to reports, the scripting of the film is likely to be completed by March 2023. The makers are trying to make the film "as authentic as possible", reports said. 'Gorkha', based on the life of Major General Ian Cardozo, will be directed by Sanjay Puran Singh Chauhan.

113.title: Will target those chanting 'Pak Zindabad' during Pune PFI stir: Rane
113.article_body: Maharashtra BJP MLA Nitesh Rane promised action over reports of 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans being raised during protests supporting PFI in Pune and said 'each will be targeted'. "To all those shouting Pakistan Zindabad slogans in support of PFI in Pune...Chun chun ke marenge...Itna yaad rakhna!!! (We will catch and strike each one of you...remember this)," tweeted Rane.

114.title: India's 1st radar to detect avalanche in 3 seconds installed in Sikkim
114.article_body: The Indian Army and Defence Geoinformatics Research Establishment (DGRE) have jointly installed an Avalanche Monitoring Radar in north Sikkim. The radar is the first of its kind in India and can detect avalanches within three seconds of their trigger. It uses a series of short microwave pulses scattered at the target to detect the avalanche.

115.title: Kartik is a director's actor, his intensity in 'Freddy' shocked me: Director
115.article_body: 'Freddy' director Shashanka Ghosh called Kartik Aaryan a director's actor and said, "His intensity in the film shocked me." "Off-screen, he comes across as a handsome and easy-going guy. But when the camera rolls, he is immersed in his role," he added. "Kartik told me that he is losing sleep because of what he was playing in 'Freddy'," said Shashanka.

116.title: Opposition leaders 'chronic liars': Punjab CM Mann
116.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday criticised Opposition leaders, calling them "chronic liars" and also accused them of being habitual of finding faults in every pro-people initiative of his government. Speaking at Faridkot, he said due to a dearth of any concrete issues, these leaders are criticising the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government only for the sake of criticism.

117.title: Punjab will get its first sign language centre in Patiala: Minister
117.article_body: Punjab Health and Family Welfare Minister Chetan Singh Jouramajra on Saturday announced that Punjab government will open the state's first centre for teaching sign language at Patiala. Attending a function organised by Patiala Association of Deaf, he said the Punjab government is not only providing special job opportunities to such people, but also taking steps to empower all the disabled.

118.title: Samruddhi Expressway will change the face of Vidarbha: Fadnavis
118.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway will change the face of Vidarbha. "It will become the next economic corridor of the country," Fadnavis said. He said there were plans to develop connectivity between Nagpur and Goa on the lines of the Samruddhi Expressway that links Vidarbha's largest city with Mumbai.

119.title: Pic shows Sule sitting on CM's chair; NCP says 'morphed', files complaint
119.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Saturday accused the spokesperson of the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction of sharing a "morphed" picture of Baramati MP Supriya Sule sitting in the CM's chair. The NCP has filed a complaint with police and demanded appropriate action against the concerned Twitter handle used for posting Sule's picture and the person who posted it.

120.title: Damn you Roger, will be walking with swollen eyes for whole weekend: Kim
120.article_body: Four-time Grand Slam champion Kim Clijsters took to Twitter after Roger Federer played the last match of his career and wrote, "Damn you Roger...will be walking around with swollen eyes for the whole weekend." Federer played a doubles match alongside Rafael Nadal for Team Europe at Laver Cup. "What an emotional night! One and only Roger Federer!" tweeted Caroline Wozniacki.

121.title: Police officer attacked by cannabis smugglers; critically injured
121.article_body: A Karnataka Police inspector was attacked by a mob of over 30 smugglers after the official and his team recovered a consignment of cannabis, a senior police officer said on Saturday. Inspector Srimant Illal sustained grievous injuries in the attack that took place on the Karnataka-Maharashtra border, police said. He is reportedly undergoing treatment and is in critical condition.

122.title: Female student filmed by her batchmates while changing clothes in MP, blackmailed
122.article_body: Three male students of Bhopal's Industrial Training Institute (ITI) allegedly recorded a video of one of their female batchmates, while she was changing clothes, police said. They later showed the clip to her friend and allegedly demanded around ₹5,000 to not leak it on social media, police said. One of the accused students' was arrested.

123.title: 32-yr-old ASHA worker from Kashmir donates blood 28 times since 2012
123.article_body: A 32-year-old Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) from Kashmir has donated blood 28 times since 2012, reports said. Bilqees Ara, who is known as 'blood woman of Kashmir', said she's proud to be the saviour of patients. "I've donated blood to...accident victims, pregnant ladies and other patients in almost every hospital in North Kashmir," the mother of three children added.

124.title: Army man who blackmailed Chandigarh University student to leak videos arrested
124.article_body: An Army personnel, who allegedly blackmailed a Chandigarh University female student to leak objectionable videos of other female students, was arrested on Saturday. The accused, identified as Sanjeev Singh, was arrested from Sela Pass, Arunachal Pradesh, officials said. So far four people, including the female student, have been arrested in connection to the leak of the videos.

125.title: India's 18-year-old Grandmaster Nihal Sarin defeats former world chess champion Kramnik
125.article_body: India's 18-year-old Grandmaster Nihal Sarin defeated ex-world chess champion Vladimir Kramnik in round of 32 of the 2022 Chess.com Global Championship. Nihal won the match with a margin of 2.5-0.5. Nihal will now face world number two Ding Liren in the round of 16. Meanwhile, India's 16-year-old Grandmaster Raunak Sadhwani crashed out of the tournament after losing to Anish Giri.

126.title: Don't worry, BJP will be wiped out: Lalu Yadav ahead of Delhi visit
126.article_body: RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav, ahead of his Delhi visit to meet Congress President Sonia Gandhi, claimed that the BJP would be "wiped out". Yadav's response came when he asked about Home Minister Amit Shah's rally in Bihar's Purnea. Lalu, after his meeting in Delhi, will also attend a rally in Haryana by former CM Om Prakash Chautala.

127.title: VHP protests outside UK Embassy over attacks on Indians in Britain
127.article_body: Members of Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Saturday gathered outside the UK Embassy in Delhi to protest against the attacks on Indians in Britain's Leicester, Birmingham and Smethwick. They were protesting in an effort to meet embassy officials. Earlier, VHP wrote a letter to UK PM Liz Truss saying that Hindus and their places of worship were targeted by extremists.

128.title: Congress won't retain Kerala LS seats it won in 2019: CM Vijayan
128.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said the Congress party will not be able to retain the Lok Sabha seats it won during the 2019 Parliamentary elections in the state. Vijayan said Congress MPs, including Rahul Gandhi, have failed to 'resist' the BJP at the national level. He added that people last time voted for Rahul thinking he would become the PM.

129.title: Rakhi Sawant is next: Hema Malini on Kangana reportedly fighting Mathura polls
129.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini responded to speculation that actor Kangana Ranaut may contest elections from her constituency in UP's Mathura and said, "Tomorrow, even Rakhi Sawant will [fight polls]." Malini further said, "So you won't even consider a local...You want only film stars in Mathura?" Ranaut earlier this week visited shrines in Vrindavan along with her family and offered prayers.

130.title: Woman dies due to power cut at hospital during C-section in Tamil Nadu
130.article_body: A 22-year-old woman reportedly died following a power outage during C-section at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Annur. According to police, the non-functioning of generator led to complications, forcing the doctors to shift her to a private hospital. She gave birth to a boy, who is fine, but after delivery, her condition deteriorated and she died.

131.title: 2 chefs of Guj girls' school held for sexually harassing students
131.article_body: Two chefs of a residential girls' school in Gujarat's Valsad district were arrested on Saturday for allegedly sexually harassing and verbally abusing tribal girl students. The principal and all seven chefs of the residential school have been transferred to other schools. The arrests came after the principal of the school lodged a complaint with the police against the accused.

132.title: Teaser of Varun's Bhediya to be shown before Vikram Vedha in cinemas: Reports
132.article_body: The teaser of Varun Dhawan and Kriti Sanon's 'Bhediya' will be shown before the shows of 'Vikram Vedha' in cinemas, according to reports. The Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer film will hit the screens on September 30. 'Bhediya', also starring Abhishek Banerjee and Deepak Dobriyal, is a horror-comedy film directed by Amar Kaushik.

133.title: Wrestler Bajrang Punia withdraws from National Games due to head injury
133.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Bajrang Punia has withdrawn from upcoming 36th National Games due to a head injury sustained during the recently concluded World Wrestling Championships in Serbia. "It's unfortunate that it happened so close to the event. The cut is fresh...will take time to heal," said Bajrang. The 28-year-old won a bronze medal in men's 65-kg category at World Championships.

134.title: Our forest cover has increased, wetlands also expanding rapidly: PM
134.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated the National Conference of Environment Ministers in Gujarat's Ekta Nagar via video conferencing. He said that India is a rapidly developing economy, which is also continuously strengthening its ecology. "Today's new India is moving ahead with new thinking [and] new approach...Our forest cover has increased and wetlands are also expanding rapidly," he added.

135.title: Jammu's mayor and deputy mayor resign following BJP meet
135.article_body: The mayor and deputy mayor of the BJP-led Jammu Municipal Corporation (JMC) on Saturday resigned from their posts following a meeting with party corporators and leaders. Mayor Chander Mohan Gupta and his deputy Purnima Sharma stepped down voluntarily, J&K BJP President Ravinder Raina said. The party will choose the next mayor and their deputy after consulting its corporators, Raina said.

136.title: Great white shark draws 'self-portrait' with its path in the ocean, pic surfaces
136.article_body: A great white shark fitted with a GPS tracker appeared to draw a self-portrait with its path in the Atlantic Ocean, experts have said. The shark named Breton was fitted with a tracker in 2020 as part of a research programme in Nova Scotia. Its movements, spanning a total of 444 days, appeared to draw the outline of a shark.

137.title: Harmanpreet breaks down ahead of Jhulan Goswami's last international match, video viral
137.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur broke down ahead of fast bowler Jhulan Goswami's last international match on Saturday. A video has gone viral showing Harmanpreet getting emotional and hugging Jhulan as the team felicitated her ahead of the ODI against England at Lord's. Harmanpreet also honoured Jhulan by going for the toss with her.

138.title: Japan ex-PM Abe’s funeral to cost more than UK Queen's funeral: Reports
138.article_body: Former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe's state funeral will cost more than UK's Queen Elizabeth II's recent state funeral, reports have said. Abe's funeral expenses are estimated to go up to 1.66 billion yen (around ₹94 crore), as against the reported cost of the Queen's funeral of 1.3 billion yen (around ₹74 crore). People have protested the funeral's high cost.

139.title: Mom didn't want me to become actor after dad's death: Gulshan's daughter
139.article_body: Actress Khushali Kumar, daughter of late Gulshan Kumar, revealed that her mother got very scared after Gulshan's death. "She didn't want to put anyone of us before...camera...Mumma told us, 'No matter what you do, do it behind...camera.' Convincing her was a process," said Khushali, who was recently seen in Madhavan-starrer 'Dhokha'. Gulshan was shot dead in Mumbai in August 1997.

140.title: Stern action against those who raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans: Fadnavis
140.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said that stern action will be taken against those who raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans in Pune. "We will find them and take action against them," Fadnavis said. His comment comes after a video of protesters purportedly raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans during a Popular Front of India (PFI) protest in Pune surfaced online.

141.title: BJP, RSS nervous due to Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Jairam Ramesh
141.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday claimed the BJP and RSS are nervous due to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which has forced the RSS chief to reach out to various sections of society. "This is the effect of our initiative," Ramesh said. Speaking about RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's visit to a mosque in Delhi, he said, "Bhagwat's visit was...a publicity stunt."

142.title: MP CM scolds official on stage over negligence, says 'you're suspended'
142.article_body: A government official was publicly scolded by Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan for failing to issue an adequate number of cards under the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana. The CM called the official on stage during a programme and asked him to explain what went wrong. "Go, you're suspended," Chouhan was purportedly heard saying, after speaking to the official.

143.title: Amit Shah to embark on a 3-day visit to J&K from Sept 30
143.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah will be on a three-day visit to Jammu and Kashmir from September 30, where he is scheduled to address two rallies and review developmental activities. However, Jammu and Kashmir BJP General Secretary Sunil Sharma said the visit should not be linked to Assembly elections. "It will be...[Shah's] direct dialogue with the people of Kashmir," Sharma said.

144.title: Bengaluru woman robbed of ₹2 lakh in cyber fraud; amount recovered later
144.article_body: After losing ₹2 lakh in online fraud, the victim, Veena Chaturvedi, got her lost amount back within 10 days after filing the complaint. Veena is the mother of Bengaluru-based comedian Jagdish Chaturvedi. "My mother had received a message from an HDFC look-alike number that said her net banking will be frozen if she doesn't verify her PAN immediately," Jagdish said.

145.title: When I hear Federer's name, I get nightmares: Ex world no. 1 Roddick
145.article_body: Paying tribute to 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer following his last career match at Laver Cup, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said, "When I hear the name of Roger, I get nightmares because he gave me nightmares for so long." Nick Kyrgios said, "He is the Michael Jordan of tennis. I think, without Roger, there's no GOAT to chase."

146.title: Argentina defeat Honduras by 3-0; Messi scores twice
146.article_body: Argentina defeated Honduras by 3-0 in a friendly game in Miami on Friday. Forward Lionel Messi scored two goals with one of them coming from a penalty strike. The match was part of the preparation for the two teams ahead of this year's FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Argentina will play their next friendly game against Jamaica on Tuesday.

147.title: 3 rare migratory birds sighted in Gurugram
147.article_body: Three migratory coastal birds, which are typically not seen in the National Capital Region, have been sighted in Gurugram's Chandu Budhera, said ornithophile Kavi Nanda. He sighted the bar-tailed godwit last week, the common ringed plover and red-necked phalarope this week. It is believed that rough weather changed the course of these birds who were flying in from Siberia.

148.title: ₹100-crore Jagannath Temple in WB's Digha to be complete by 2023
148.article_body: The ₹100-crore Jagannath Temple being built by the West Bengal government in Digha will be completed by December 2023, an official said on Saturday. The temple, resembling the centuries-old Jagannath Temple in Odisha's Puri, is being built on a 20-acre plot near the Old Digha beach. The 65-metre-high temple will have idols of Lord Jagannath, Lord Balabhadra and Goddess Subhadra.

149.title: Tender floated to procure 3,980 electric buses for Delhi
149.article_body: Convergence Energy Services Limited, a subsidiary under the Union Power Ministry, has floated a tender to procure 3,980 electric buses for Delhi. The tender was floated on September 21. Valued at around ₹5,000 crore, the tender aims to procure 5,690 electric buses. Other than Delhi, the remaining buses are for Haryana, Telangana, Arunachal Pradesh and Gujarat states.

150.title: Part of hill collapses in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh; 40 stranded
150.article_body: A massive landslide in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh blocked the Tawaghat-Lipulekh highway after part of a hill collapsed near Najang Tamba on Friday evening. At least 40 pilgrims, who undertook the Adi Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, along with local residents are reportedly stranded due to the closure of the highway. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far.

151.title: Aaron Finch's reaction after getting clean bowled on Jasprit Bumrah's yorker goes viral
151.article_body: A video of Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch's reaction after getting clean bowled on India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's yorker in the second T20I in Nagpur has gone viral. In the video, Finch can be seen applauding Bumrah for this delivery. Finch was dismissed for 31(15). India went on to win the match by six wickets.

152.title: What is CBI's 'Operation Megha Chakra' against child porn?
152.article_body: CBI has launched a nationwide operation code-named 'Operation Megha Chakra', aimed at cracking down on the circulation of child pornography and those circulating it. The name indicates the alleged offences of downloading and distributing Child Sexual Exploitation Material (CSEM) via 'Cloud Space'. Raids were carried out in Delhi, UP, Bihar, Punjab, Haryana, Maharashtra, Gujarat and other states.

153.title: Week-long 'Infinite Library' project begins in Pune
153.article_body: The Max Mueller Bhavan began showcasing on Saturday a week-long 'Infinite Library' project in Pune. The project aims to show libraries of the future using a virtual reality installation. Creative Director of 'Infinite Library' Mika Johnson said the project "will help to reimagine history and understand interrelations". The project can be viewed free of cost but pre-registration is mandatory.

154.title: Rafael Nadal pulls out of Laver Cup due to personal reasons
154.article_body: Rafael Nadal has pulled out of Laver Cup due to personal reasons. This comes after he teamed up with Roger Federer for a doubles match for Team Europe against Team World. "I'm not doing well. It's been a tough time for me, I hardly slept...I was stressful," Nadal said after the match, which was the last match of Federer's career.

155.title: I'm getting to fulfil my childhood dream in 'Code Name: Tiranga': Parineeti
155.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra, who'll play an agent in the upcoming film 'Code Name: Tiranga', said, "Growing up, I fantasised being an agent for my country." She added that she used to carry a toy gun and pretend she was the best agent in service of the country. "So, I'm getting to fulfil my childhood dream in [the film]," said Parineeti.

156.title: Tenders invited to build underground tunnel for Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor
156.article_body: Tenders have been invited to build a 7-km-long tunnel under the sea, a first of its kind in the country. This will be part of the 21-km-long tunnel, which will be built in Maharashtra for the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail Corridor. The tunnel will be between the Bandra-Kurla Complex underground station and Shilphata in Maharashtra.

157.title: Man steals 30 motorcycles in B'luru to pay gambling debts, arrested
157.article_body: A professional photographer has been arrested for allegedly stealing around 30 motorcycles in Bengaluru and selling them in his hometown in Tumakuru to pay gambling debts. N Sridhar alias Chingari used to steal motorcycles parked on roadsides in residential localities whenever he faced a financial crisis, police said. He would reportedly wear a helmet to avoid being stopped by police.

158.title: Over 38,000 FYJC seats vacant after 5 rounds of admissions in Pune
158.article_body: After three regular and two special sessions of admissions for first-year junior college (FYJC), 38,255 seats remained vacant in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions. Assistant Director of Education, Pune, Meena Shendkar said students must be careful before cancelling their seats as there may be no more rounds for admission. Colleges will release the list of admitted students on September 25.

159.title: Mom & dad were very protective, we lived an insular life: Shweta Bachchan
159.article_body: Amitabh and Jaya Bachchan's daughter Shweta Bachchan has said she grew up in a protective environment. She also revealed that she and her brother Abhishek Bachchan were kept away from the glamour world during their growing-up years. "We...didn't understand much of what was going on out there...We never had magazines at home...TV in...80s was minimal...We lived...[an] insular life," Shweta added.

160.title: University of Hyderabad students protest against exam fees hike
160.article_body: University of Hyderabad (UoH) students on Friday protested against hike in examination fees and raised slogans outside the office of Controller of Examinations (CoE) on campus. Shiva Durga Rao, secretary of the Students Federation of India (SFI) on campus, said examination fees were hiked from ₹600 to ₹4,000. Rao said the security guards manhandled students when they were protesting peacefully.

161.title: Rohit was brilliant, Axar was the difference: Finch on 2nd T20I loss
161.article_body: Following Australia's six-wicket loss against India in second T20I, Australia captain Aaron Finch said India captain Rohit Sharma's "brilliant" knock of 20-ball 46* and two overs bowled by Axar Patel made the difference. Axar posted bowling figures of 2-0-13-2. Match was reduced to eight overs per side amid wet outfield. India chased down the 91-run target in 7.2 overs.

162.title: 77-yr-old yoga tutor jailed for sexually abusing 5-yr-old girl in B'luru
162.article_body: A 77-year-old yoga tutor has been sentenced to five years in prison for sexually assaulting a five-year-old student in Bengaluru. The incident took place in August 2018. The minor's mother had sent her to a guest room in the yoga centre to collect some books when the convict, who was alone inside, locked the door and sexually assaulted her.

163.title: 'Model of fraud': Congress on Delhi govt's education model
163.article_body: The Congress party on Saturday said the education model being promoted by the AAP-led Delhi government is a "model of fraud". The party added that if the "so-called education model" is replicated in other states, the entire education system will be "ruined". Congress claimed that its government built 150 schools in Delhi whereas Arvind Kejriwal's government hardly built 20 schools.

164.title: 30-yr-old man strangles live-in partner to death in Thane; arrested
164.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly strangling his 24-year-old live-in partner to death in Bhiwandi town of Thane district in Maharashtra. He was arrested by police while transporting the woman's body in an ambulance. The accused has been identified as Saddam Sharif Sayyed, a resident of Kalyan.

165.title: Must 'deal decisively': Iran's Prez on protests over Amini's death
165.article_body: Iran must "deal decisively with those who oppose the country's security and tranquillity", Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said on Saturday while speaking about the protests which erupted following the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. She was allegedly assaulted by Iranian police over "improper hijab". At least 35 people have been killed in demonstrations against Amini's death across Iran.

166.title: Hyderabad to become 1st city to treat 100% sewage by 2023: KT Rama Rao
166.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao monitored the progress of the construction of Sewage Treatment Plants (STPs) across various sites in Hyderabad on Saturday. "STPs with 1,259 MLD (Million Litres per Day) capacity of treatment will be completed by summer 2023, making Hyderabad probably the first city to treat 100% of its sewerage," he tweeted, sharing photos from the site.

167.title: CBI launches massive crackdown on child porn, raids 56 places across India
167.article_body: The CBI on Saturday raided 56 places across 19 states and one Union Territory in the country as part of a massive crackdown on child pornography. The raids were carried out as part of two cases of circulation of Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM), officials said. They were conducted based on inputs from Interpol Singapore.

168.title: Ankita was killed for refusing 'special services' to resort guests: U'khand Police
168.article_body: Uttarakhand DGP Ashok Kumar on Saturday said 19-year-old Ankita Bhandari, who was allegedly murdered by ex-BJP leader Vinod Arya's son Pulkit, was being pressured to provide 'special services' to guests. She was killed after she refused to provide the 'services', Kumar said. Ankita's friend has reportedly alleged that Pulkit, the resort's owner, was pressuring Ankita to have sex with guests.

169.title: Britannia appoints Rajneet Kohli as CEO, elevates Varun Berry as Executive VC & MD
169.article_body: Britannia Industries' board announced the appointment of Rajneet Kohli as Executive Director and CEO effective September 26, 2022. It also elevated Varun Berry to Executive Vice-Chairman and Managing Director with immediate effect. In his career spanning over 25 years, Kohli has served in senior leadership roles in Asian Paints and Coca-Cola and is joining Britannia from Jubilant FoodWorks.

170.title: Rohit's ability to play against fast bowling is second to none: Karthik
170.article_body: Commenting on India captain Rohit Sharma's 20-ball 46* in second T20I against Australia, India batter Dinesh Karthik said his teammate played brilliantly. "His ability to play against fast bowling is second to none...that's what makes him truly special as a batter," he added. Rohit was adjudged 'Player of the Match'. He hit four fours and four sixes during his knock.

171.title: 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans raised at PFI protest in Pune; probe on
171.article_body: A video of protesters purportedly raising "Pakistan Zindabad" slogans during a protest by the Popular Front of India (PFI) in Pune has surfaced online. Pro-Pakistan slogans were reportedly heard when protesters were taken into custody and made to sit in a police vehicle outside the District Collector's office on Friday. Pune Police said they are investigating the matter.

172.title: I changed a lot after working with Irrfan Khan: Tabu
172.article_body: Actress Tabu said in an interview that she changed a lot after working with Irrfan Khan. The duo shared screen space in films like 'Maqbool' and 'The Namesake'. Tabu added, "It's like those people who come into your life and redefine it and make you see things differently. I learnt to be completely true to my characters and myself."

173.title: Anupam shares video of niece singing song from 'Hichki', says 'She's autistic'
173.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video of his niece, Tanvi, singing 'Teri Dastaan' from the film 'Hichki' for him and other family members at a gathering.
