Along with the video, Anupam wrote that she's autistic. "My [sister's] daughter #Tanvi (Autistic) has...most beautiful smile in the world! She...sings with abundant joy...Enjoy the song and bless her," he wrote.

174.title: 1 worker killed, 3 injured in factory blast in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
174.article_body: A 60-year-old worker, Bhagwati Singh, was killed and three others were injured after a blast at an acetylene manufacturing factory in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Saturday. The explosion reportedly took place at JK Enterprises on Jalandhar road during the refilling of cylinders. Technical experts had been called to determine the cause of the blast, Deputy Superintendent of Police Surinder Pal said.

175.title: 2 killed as typhoon hits central Japan; thousands without power
175.article_body: Typhoon Talas struck central Japan on Saturday, unleashing torrential rains and severe winds that left tens of thousands of households without power, as per local media. Two deaths due to the storm were also reported. Wind speed at the centre of the typhoon was recorded at about 65 km/h with peak gusts of about 90 km/h, Japan's meteorological agency informed.

176.title: He's going to break people's toes: Kaneria after Bumrah's bowling in 2nd T20I
176.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah following his performance in India's six-wicket win against Australia in second T20I, Danish Kaneria said the India pacer is back on track. "Opposition teams must beware, as he's looking in a great rhythm...He bowled an excellent spell under pressure. He's going to break people's toes at...T20 World Cup," he added. Bumrah posted bowling figures of 2-0-23-1.

177.title: PM Modi selectively quoted by western leaders: Russia on 'not an era of war' remark
177.article_body: Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov has reacted to PM Narendra Modi's "not an era of war" remark to Russian President Vladimir Putin, which was lauded at the UN. He said, "Western leaders who quoted the...remarks on Ukraine...conveniently picked out parts of that conversation that suits their rhetoric." He added that Russia also wants a peaceful resolution in Ukraine.

178.title: Doctor dies after car hits bike taxi in Hyderabad; 1 arrested
178.article_body: A doctor died on Saturday after being injured in a road accident in Hyderabad's Malakpet on Tuesday night. Dr Sravani, a resident of Hasthinapuram, was on her way to Malakpet on a bike taxi when a car hit the vehicle. The taxi driver and Sravani sustained injuries. The car driver, who escaped from the site, was taken into custody later.

179.title: Activating Starlink: Musk to Blinken on internet shutdown in Iran
179.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said he is activating satellite internet service, Starlink, amid internet shutdown in Iran over protests. Musk was responding to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's tweet that the US took action "to advance internet freedom and the free flow of information" to Iranians. US issued guidance to expand internet services to Iranians despite US sanctions.

180.title: Centre's various decisions based on Gandhian philosophy: VP Dhankhar
180.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday asserted that various decisions of central government were based on Gandhian philosophy. The philosophy of 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vishwas, Sabka Vikas and Sabka Prayas' is a Gandhian thought and rises above "all politics", he stated. "The Mahatma's soul will be satisfied" as government ensured two doses of coronavirus vaccine during the pandemic, he added.

181.title: SSB jawans fought and wiped out Naxalism in Bihar & J’khand: Shah
181.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the role of Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) and said that Naxalism has been finished in Bihar and Jharkhand due to the efforts of jawans. "Naxalism is on the brink of ending in the Bihar and Jharkhand regions...We can even say it is finished here," Shah said.

182.title: Congress 'aged', it will be AAP vs BJP in Gujarat: Raghav Chadha
182.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Saturday said that the Gujarat elections will be a direct contest between his party and the BJP. He dismissed Congress as an "aged" party that hasn't won in almost three decades. "After a 27-year rule of the BJP, now is time for a change, time for the Arvind Kejriwal model of governance," said Chadha.

183.title: MVA govt didn't function as per Bal Thackeray's principles: Maha minister
183.article_body: Maharashtra minister Dadaji Bhuse on Friday criticised former CM Uddhav Thackeray and claimed that the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government did not function as per the principles and teachings of Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray. Only the Congress and NCP benefitted from the alliance, Bhuse added. He was addressing a group of Shiv Sena workers from CM Eknath Shinde's faction.

184.title: Dhoni was open to everyone's suggestions: Harbhajan on India's 2007 T20 WC win
184.article_body: Recalling Team India's 2007 T20 World Cup win on its 15th anniversary on Saturday, Harbhajan Singh said it didn't feel to the team that MS Dhoni was the captain before he took the trophy as everyone was giving their suggestions. "He was very open to it and would let us go ahead with whatever we thought was best," he added.

185.title: Cong is playing 'dirty politics': K'taka CM on PayCM campaign
185.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai accused the Congress of playing "dirty politics" in connection with its PayCM campaign in the state. "They should give evidence, records and it has to be investigated. Without anything in their heads, they come to the session. This shows their moral degradation. This campaign is taken without any morality and mudslinging programme," said Bommai.

186.title: Patna HC stays demolition of Sultan Palace, seeks reply from Bihar govt
186.article_body: Patna High Court stayed the proposed demolition of Sultan Palace, commonly known as Parivahan Bhawan, and sought a reply from the Bihar government. This comes after a PIL was filed by a Patna-based lawyer. Bihar government had earlier granted approval for the construction of three five-star hotels in Patna, including one at the site where the Sultan Palace is built.

187.title: MP man stabs 7-yr-old 12 times, says he was helping her meet her parents
187.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Indore reportedly killed his seven-year-old neighbour on Friday. According to the police, the accused abducted the girl, who lost her parents a few years back, took her to his house and stabbed her at least 12 times. "The man said he was trying to help her as she wanted to meet her parents," police said.

188.title: Bankrupt crypto firm Voyager's CFO to quit months after appointment
188.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Voyager Digital, which filed for bankruptcy in July, announced on Friday that its Chief Financial Officer Ashwin Prithipaul is stepping down from his role and would leave after a "transition period". This comes within months of his appointment in May. Voyager said its Chief Executive Officer Stephen Ehrlich will head the role of the CFO in the interim.

189.title: Ghaziabad man's adopted daughter suspected of killing him
189.article_body: A 14-year-old girl has been identified as the prime suspect in her adoptive father's murder case in Ghaziabad. The man was found dead at his home in Vaishali Sector 4 on Thursday, police said. The deceased and his adopted daughter had a strained relationship over a rape case that was filed against the latter's friend, police said citing his wife.

190.title: Yes Bank to exit Reconstruction Scheme after lock-in period ends
190.article_body: Yes Bank said on Friday it has amended the July 15 announcement regarding its exit from the Reconstruction Scheme, 2020 after receiving clarification from the RBI. The bank said the RBI would allow it to exit the scheme, which it entered in March 2020, after the end of a three-year lock-in period for 75% of shares held by existing shareholders.

191.title: Some investors pull out of Digital World's plan to buy Trump's app
191.article_body: Blank-cheque company, Digital World Acquisition, said some investors are backing out of its plan to acquire former US President Donald Trump's social media firm Truth Social. Investors, who signed the private investment in public equity commitment, have terminated nearly $139 million in investments of $1 billion commitment. Digital World didn't disclose the investors who pulled out investments.

192.title: 28-yr-old man strangles wife to death over argument in Thane, held
192.article_body: A 28-year-old man, Anil Laxman Lokhande, was arrested for allegedly strangling his 25-year-old wife, Meena, to death at their house in Thane's Kalwa over an argument, police said on Saturday. The couple used to frequently fight and the accused strangled his wife in the early hours of Friday, senior inspector Manohar Awhad said.

193.title: Unichem gets ₹270 cr from Sekhmet for 19.97% stake sale in Optimus
193.article_body: Drug firm Unichem Laboratories on Friday said it received ₹270 crore as the first tranche of payment from Sekhmet Pharmaventures Private Limited for the sale of 19.97% equity shares in Optimus Drugs Private Limited. A consortium of private equity funds, led by PAG, had announced in May that it will acquire a controlling stake in Optimus Drugs for ₹2,000 crore.

194.title: Australia's 2nd largest telco Optus contacts customers after data leak
194.article_body: Australia's second-largest telecommunications company said it was contacting "all customers to notify them of the previously announced cyberattack's impact, if any, on their personal details". "We will begin with customers whose ID document number may have been compromised, all of whom will be notified by today...No passwords or financial details have been compromised," Optus said.

195.title: Inspired by crime TV show, 3 people rob Mumbai celebrity dentist of ₹12 lakh
195.article_body: Three people have been arrested for allegedly stealing ₹12 lakh from a celebrity dentist in Mumbai. Reports said that the accused were inspired by a crime television show. The three also stole ornaments and expensive watches, as per reports. Police were able to catch all three accused after scanning over 500 CCTV footages.

196.title: Woman constable felicitated for saving life at Hyd's Gymkhana during stampede
196.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand felicitated woman constable, Dawa Naveena, who administered CPR to a woman injured in the stampede outside Gymkhana Ground. "I didn't hesitate and immediately administered CPR to the woman for a few minutes and the woman started breathing," 2020 batch recruit Naveena said. She was awarded with an appreciation certificate and a cash reward of ₹5,000.

197.title: We shouldn't always equate fun with money: Google CEO to staff amid cost-cutting
197.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai held an all-hands meeting with employees amid cost-cutting and cultural changes at the company. Upon being asked about the withdrawal of some perks, Pichai said, “I remember when Google was small and scrappy...We shouldn’t always equate fun with money...You can walk into a hard-working startup and people may be having fun...it shouldn’t always equate to money."

198.title: Clip shows Scarlet Witch's deleted action scene from Doctor Strange 2, video viral
198.article_body: A video is going viral on social media showing a deleted action scene from 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. Scarlet Witch, portrayed by Elizabeth Olsen, can be seen engaged in hand-to-hand combat using magic and puppeteering a dead soldier. A social media user commented, "We were robbed," while another wrote, "It's amazing...but...was probably too violent for the studio."

199.title: Unstable coalition govts affected India's image for decades: PM Modi
199.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said for many decades in the country, coalition governments were formed that were unstable. "Nobody trusted India for anything," he added. "Eight years back, in 2014, alert voters formed a majority government. As a result, a stable government was formed. This led to...change in policy-making too," he said, adding, "World now trusts us more."

200.title: Prices of leafy veggies surge in Navi Mumbai; bunch of coriander costs ₹70
200.article_body: After heavy rainfall impacted the supply of green vegetables in most parts of Maharashtra, the prices of leafy vegetables surged. The price of a bunch of coriander leaves increased to ₹70 in Navi Mumbai, and traders believe there will be no respite for at least a fortnight. As per Agricultural Produce Market Committee, vegetable supply has decreased by around 30%.

201.title: BMC to screen 40 lakh citizens for TB, leprosy in Mumbai from Sept 26
201.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will conduct a tuberculosis and leprosy detection campaign from September 26, where civic teams will engage in doorstep visits and screen over 40 lakh residents. "If a person is found to have symptoms of TB, then their sputum will be examined and X-rays will be done free of cost," BMC executive health officer said.

202.title: Over 60 booked in Pune for holding protest over raids against PFI
202.article_body: Pune City Police have booked more than 60 persons for holding a protest without permission against the raids on the Popular Front of India (PFI). "We've registered an offence against more than 60 persons, including 41 who were detained yesterday...for unlawful assembly...blocking the road," police said. Police had given a notice to the organisers not to hold any protest.

203.title: Anticipatory bail granted to ex ADG (Law and Order) in cheating case
203.article_body: The Delhi High Court granted anticipatory bail to the former ADG (Law and Order) of Haryana in a cheating case registered in 2016 against a private company and its directors and employees. The court said that the accused has no previous antecedents against him. The bail order asked the accused to furnish a personal bond of ₹50,000.

204.title: Perhaps you're 'too much' angry with me: Punjab Guv to CM Mann
204.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann stated that state Governor Banwarilal Purohit's office seeking details of an Assembly session  was "too much", Purohit wrote to Mann, saying, "Perhaps you are 'too much' angry with me." He asked Mann to read Articles 167 and 168 of the Constitution and added, "I think your legal advisors are not briefing you adequately."

205.title: K'taka man dies of heart attack after son held over suspected terror links
205.article_body: A man died of a heart attack in Karnataka's Shivamogga after his 22-year-old son was arrested on suspicion of having links with terror outfits. The deceased was reportedly upset with his son's arrest. His body was taken from Mangaluru to Thirthahalli in an ambulance by his relatives where the last rites were performed.

206.title: Assam CM, Sadhguru to take part in three-day 'Chintan Shivir'
206.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma, along with all the ministers and senior secretaries of the government, will be attending a three-day 'Chintan Shivir', which is set to begin today. They will be discussing the ongoing activities of the departments and chalk out a strategy for the next five years. Spiritual leader Sadhguru will also take part in the shivir today.

207.title: Petrol bomb hurled at RSS member's house near Chennai
207.article_body: A petrol bomb was thrown at RSS functionary Seetharaman's home in Tambaram, near Chennai, Tamil Nadu. "We heard a loud sound and saw fire outside around 4 am. We thought it was a short circuit, but it wasn't the case. We doused the fire and called police officials. They got the footage of the accused," Seetharaman said.

208.title: Brahmāstra witnesses 240% one-day jump at box office on National Cinema Day
208.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra' witnessed a 240% one-day jump at the box office on National Cinema Day on Friday. As per trade sources, the Ayan Mukerji-directorial earned ₹11 crore nett in all languages on Friday from just over ₹3 crore the previous day. Most theatre chains and halls sold tickets at flat ₹75 on National Cinema Day.

209.title: Pic of Novak Djokovic coaching Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer in Laver Cup goes viral
209.article_body: A picture of Novak Djokovic coaching Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer during their doubles match in Laver Cup has gone viral on social media. The match was Federer's last of his professional career. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "The most beautiful sight in tennis!" Another wrote, "So lucky I got to see these three play!"

210.title: Virat Kohli's reaction to crowd chanting 'RCB, RCB' goes viral
210.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli's reaction to crowd chanting 'RCB, RCB' during the second T20I against Australia in Nagpur has gone viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen pointing towards the BCCI  badge on his training jersey. All-rounder Harshal Patel can also be seen pointing towards the BCCI badge in the video.

211.title: He was a little reserved during shoot: Sharib on 'Vikram...' co-star Hrithik
211.article_body: Actor Sharib Hashmi, opening up about his experience of working with Hrithik Roshan in 'Vikram Vedha', said he was "a little reserved" during the shoot. "I didn't have much interaction," he said. Sharib, however, added Hrithik is a "chilled person" and doesn't have an attitude. "When we'd packed up, he came and told me...he liked working with me," Sharib said.

212.title: Most beautiful sporting pic ever: Kohli on pic of Nadal crying during Federer's farewell
212.article_body: Virat Kohli shared a picture of Rafael Nadal crying during Roger Federer's farewell on Instagram and said, "Who thought rivals can feel like this towards each other." Kohli added, "This is the most beautiful sporting picture ever for me...Nothing but respect for these two." Federer, who played his career's last match at the Laver Cup in London, was also emotional.

213.title: He just hands himself over to you: Sudhir on working with Nawaz
213.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra spoke about working with Nawazuddin Siddiqui in the movie 'Serious Men' and called his experience "wonderful". "He just hands himself over to you and he's this perfect," he added. The film, which was released in 2020, also featured Nassar and Shweta Basu Prasad. 'Serious Men' was based on the book of the same name by Manu Joseph.

214.title: BJP supporters built temple of UP CM Yogi to capture barren land: SP
214.article_body: The Samajwadi Party (SP) has claimed that Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's temple near Ayodhya was built by "BJP supporters" to "capture" a barren land owned by an individual. The party called BJP "the biggest land mafia". It also shared a video showing a man alleging that his nephew constructed the temple on his (the man's) land without his permission.

215.title: PFI has major plans to trigger unrest in India: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
215.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said the Popular Front of India (PFI) has large-scale plans to trigger unrest in country. "PFI has now adopted a new modus operandi. It was working towards creating communal tension," Fadnavis added. He further claimed that raids at PFI premises across the country show that there was adequate proof with NIA and ATS.

216.title: Dhoni did so well for India despite having no technique: Kiran More
216.article_body: Former Team India selector Kiran More said MS Dhoni did so well for India despite having "no technique". "I give a lot of credit to [ex-Team India coach] Greg Chappell, the way he moulded Dhoni and used him in the right place," added More. "Dhoni showed the world how the game can be played...with a great mind," he stated.

217.title: Body of unidentified woman found floating in a lake in Thane
217.article_body: The body of an unidentified woman was found floating in the Makhmali Talao lake in Thane, Maharashtra on Saturday morning. A team of the fire brigade and personnel from Naupada Police Station as well as the Regional Disaster Management Cell reached the spot and recovered the body, an official said. The woman was presumably around 50 years old, he added.

218.title: Netflix dismisses copyright suit against 'Unofficial Bridgerton Musical'
218.article_body: Netflix has dismissed a copyright infringement lawsuit against the creators of 'The Unofficial Bridgerton Musical', a Grammy-winning album based on Netflix's show 'Bridgerton'. The suit was filed after a sold-out performance of the musical at Washington DC's Kennedy Center in July. Abigail Barlow and Emily Bear, the creators of the musical, had initially started posting about the album on TikTok.

219.title: BJP MLA's car vandalised in Rishikesh over Ankita Bhandari's murder
219.article_body: Locals protesting over the murder of 19-year-old receptionist Ankita Bhandari vandalised BJP MLA Renu Bisht's car in Uttarakhand's Rishikesh on Saturday. The MLA was escorted away by police. Three persons, including former BJP minister Vinod Arya's son Pulkit Arya, have been arrested on charges of murder of Ankita. Locals also set ablaze the resort owned by Pulkit, where Ankita worked.

220.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested in Hyderabad; items worth ₹2 lakh seized
220.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested two drug peddlers including a foreign national on Friday. They also seized ₹2 lakh worth of items including 17 grams of MDMA, two cell phones and cash. One of the accused has been identified as 50-year-old Anthony Boateng Amihere, who is from Africa but resides illegally in Bengaluru. Another accused is a resident of Andhra Pradesh.

221.title: Video of fight at Kanpur hospital surfaces online, UP Police respond
221.article_body: A video of a fight between people at Aashvi Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur was shared by a Twitter user. The user said that some miscreants came from outside and beat up the hospital staff. Uttar Pradesh Police, while replying to the tweet, directed the Police Commissionerate of Kanpur Nagar to take necessary action.

222.title: Delhi-Noida drive may become signal-free with Chilla elevated road
222.article_body: The Noida Authority has sought funds of ₹650 crore to restart the construction of the Chilla elevated road that will make Noida-Delhi drive signal-free. The road will connect Sector 14A Chilla regulator near Mayur Vihar in Delhi to Noida's Mahamaya flyover. Its construction was earlier halted due to National Green Tribunal's objection to pollution, COVID-19 pandemic, and lack of funds.

223.title: We laughed, cried, celebrated with you: Laver after Federer's last match
223.article_body: Following Roger Federer's last career match at Laver Cup in London, Rod Laver took to Twitter and wrote, "Retirement comes to all at some stage, but it seems the greater the player, the harder the moment. That was hard, Federer." He added, "We laughed, and cried, and celebrated with you, and we'll continue to do so for a long time."

224.title: India-Bhutan border gates reopen for tourists after 2.5 years
224.article_body: The India-Bhutan border gates in Assam were reopened for tourists on Friday after two and a half years, an official said. The border gates, which were closed amid the coronavirus pandemic, have been reopened with some new rules along with a sustainable development fee, the official added. The gates will stay open between 9 am and 5 pm.

225.title: National Cinema Day sets new record with over 65 lakh cinegoers
225.article_body: National Cinema Day saw a record of over 65 lakh estimated cinema-goers on September 23, confirmed the Multiplex Association of India (MAI). Over 4,000 screens participated in the initiative with cinema operators reporting housefull shows throughout the day. Some theatres had shows starting at 6 am due to unprecedented demand for movie tickets, reported Free Press Journal.

226.title: Sylvester Stallone, wife Jennifer Flavin reconcile a month after she filed for divorce
226.article_body: Actor Sylvester Stallone and former model and his wife Jennifer Flavin have reconciled a month after she filed for divorce. "They decided to meet back up at home, where they talked and were able to work out their differences," the couple's spokesperson said. The couple have been married for 25 years and are parents to three daughters.

227.title: 'K.G.F' director Prashanth Neel is fabulous with actors: Shruti Haasan
227.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan has stated that the director of 'K.G.F' series Prashanth Neel is fabulous with his actors. "It's nice to work with a director who is so clear-headed about their vision...He really creates this world and it is our job as actors to melt into his world," the actress added. She will be seen in Prashanth's directorial 'Salaar'.

228.title: I was quite surprised: Rohit on his 20-ball 46* in 2nd T20I vs Aus
228.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said he was "quite surprised" with his unbeaten 46 off 20 balls in the second T20I against Australia. "I didn't expect it to go quite as well as that," added Rohit. "When you're playing a game like that, you can't plan too much. You...have to play the situation and use conditions to your advantage," he stated.

229.title: Some are unhappy to see me happy: Neha after criticism on 'Maine Payal...' remake
229.article_body: Singer Neha Kakkar said some people are "unhappy" seeing her "happy and successful" and she felt "sorry" for such people, after facing backlash over her song 'O Sajna'. "Please keep commenting. I won't even delete them because I know and everybody knows what Neha Kakkar is!" she said. 'O Sajna' is a remake of Fulguni Pathak's 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai'.

230.title: PM Narendra Modi to launch 5G services in India on October 1
230.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will launch 5G services in India on October 1 at India Mobile Congress, touted to be Asia's largest technology exhibition. Earlier in August, the Department of Telecom received total bids worth ₹1.50 lakh crore from the spectrum auction. Reliance Jio, Adani Group, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea were the four major participants in the spectrum auction.

231.title: Thanks for loving 'Chura Ke Dil Mera': Shilpa on 28 years of 'Main...'
231.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Friday took to Instagram Stories to celebrate 28 years since the release of 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari'. She shared footage of the song from the film, writing alongside, "Thank you for loving 'Chura Ke Dil Mera'." The song was recreated for the 2021 film 'Hungama 2' which marked Shilpa's comeback to films after nearly 15 years.

232.title: Gurugram roads flooded after heavy rain; Twitter users share pics, videos
232.article_body: Gurugram roads were flooded after heavy rainfall lashed the city and its surrounding areas on Friday and Saturday. Several Twitter users shared pictures and videos of the flooded roads. One user called Gurugram "Delhi's very own Bengaluru". Another one said this is the condition of the city every year after rains.

233.title: 2 shepherds die trying to save lamb that fell into borewell in UP
233.article_body: Two shepherds, aged 22 and 55, died of suffocation while trying to rescue a lamb that had fallen into a borewell in UP's Mathura on Friday, said police. One of the shepherds got down into the borewell first and when he did not return, the other went after him. Their bodies were pulled out after a two-hour operation.

234.title: Man seen struggling to stand on road 'due to drugs' in Punjab; video surfaces
234.article_body: A video of man struggling to stand allegedly under influence of drugs in Punjab's Amritsar is being widely circulated on social media. This comes days after a video showed a woman struggling to stand on a busy street in the city allegedly because of drugs, following which police launched an investigation.

235.title: Neighbours call my house 'Sita ka ghar'; I've always felt mother's guilt: Shweta
235.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari has stated that she had always felt the mother's guilt, especially when her daughter Palak was growing up. "Whatever time I would get...would get wasted because of my messed up situation in my personal life," she added. Shweta further said that the neighbours call her house 'Sita ka ghar' because their house is full of ladies.

236.title: Govt issues advisory for IT workers, warns of fake job rackets in Thailand
236.article_body: The Centre issued an advisory regarding fake job rackets targeting IT professionals. MEA said that missions in Thailand and Myanmar detected instances of "fake job rackets offering lucrative jobs to entice Indian youths for the posts of 'Digital Sales and Marketing Executives' in Thailand". It added, these rackets are being operated by firms involved in call-centre scams and cryptocurrency fraud.

237.title: OnePlus offers deals on entire 5G portfolio
237.article_body: OnePlus has announced festive offers on its entire 5G portfolio including its newly launched OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition at a discounted introductory price of ₹32,999. OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition offers a free 3-month Prime membership, an exchange bonus of ₹3,000*, and more. The brand has also announced exciting offers on other products including Smart TVs, Audio and Wearables.

238.title: India's forex reserves drop to $545.65 bn, lowest since Oct 2020
238.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell to their lowest level since October 2, 2020, RBI data showed. The reserves fell by $5.2 billion to $545.65 billion as of September 16. This is the seventh weekly fall in the forex reserves and it is because of a decline in foreign currency assets by $4.69 billion to $484.90 billion, the data showed.

239.title: Delhi LG alleges ₹20 cr fraud in Jal Board headed by Sisodia, seeks FIR
239.article_body: Delhi LG Vinai Kumar Saxena sought an FIR against officials of Delhi Jal Board (DJB), headed by Manish Sisodia, claiming an "embezzlement" of ₹20 crore. LG directed Chief Secretary to identify the accused and submit a report within 15 days. DJB allegedly collected ₹20 crore as bills from consumers and sent it to a private bank account for several years.

240.title: I was sexually harassed by producer on 'Fresh Off the Boat' set: Constance Wu
240.article_body: Actress Constance Wu, known for portraying Rachel in 'Crazy Rich Asians', has revealed that she was sexually harassed by a producer on the sets of 'Fresh Off the Boat'. She said that the producer touched her thigh and grazed her crotch in 2015. "I thought...'I don't have to stain this Asian American producer's reputation...the reputation of the show'," Constance said.

241.title: I once drove behind Salman Khan's car to get a glimpse: Dulquer
241.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has revealed that he once drove behind actor Salman Khan's car to get a glimpse of the latter, adding he could see him sitting in the front seat. "We were hoping he would get down from the car so we could see him...I have not met Salman sir till date," the actor said.

242.title: I try to get into a player's shoes, getting angry doesn't help: Dhoni
242.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni said he always tries to get into the shoes of his players to figure out the reason behind a dropped catch or misfield. "Getting angry does not help...If a player is 100% attentive...I don't have a problem," added Dhoni. "Of course, I...want to see how many catches he took during practice," he stated.

243.title: Locals set U'khand resort on fire after body of 19-yr-old receptionist found in canal
243.article_body: After body of Ankita Bhandari, a 19-year-old receptionist who worked at former BJP Uttarakhand minister Vinod Arya's son's resort, was found in a canal in Uttarakhand, locals set the resort on fire on Saturday. Three people including the BJP leader's son, Pulkit Arya, have been arrested in the case. A Special Investigation Team has also been set up.

244.title: CBI conducts nationwide raids against online child sexual abuse
244.article_body: The CBI on Saturday carried out raids across 56 locations in 19 states and one Union Territory against the circulation of child sexual abuse material online, said officials. Code-named 'Operation Megha Chakra', the crackdown came following inputs from Singapore Interpol. The operation is targeted at cloud storage facilities used to circulate videos of illicit sexual activities involving minors.

245.title: Mother leaves 4-yr-old girl alone in locked house in Chandigarh, booked
245.article_body: Police have booked a woman for endangering the safety of her four-year-old daughter by leaving her alone in a locked house in Chandigarh. The incident occurred in August 2021 at Sector-29 where the woman had been living with her parents due to a marital dispute. A complaint was filed by the girl's father who found her locked inside the house.

246.title: Pune girl critical after father fires gun during fight with mother
246.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was critically injured after her father allegedly fired a gun during a fight with her mother at their home in Pune, police said. The girl's father was arrested and the gun, for which he has a licence, was also seized. "The girl was admitted to...hospital. [Doctors] operated on her earlier this morning," DCP (Zone-3) Pornima Gaikwad said.

247.title: Doctors remove nail cutter from 8-month-old baby's throat in Nashik; pics surface
247.article_body: Doctors in Maharashtra's Nashik removed a five-cm-long nail cutter from the throat of an eight-month-old baby who swallowed it accidentally. "Initially, we were not able to get a good grip on the nail cutter. During the process, it had slid a little further but after a 30-minute procedure, we were eventually able to remove the object," a doctor said.

248.title: U'khand BJP leader expelled from party after son held in receptionist's murder case
248.article_body: The BJP on Saturday expelled Vinod Arya and Ankit Arya, the father and brother of main accused Pulkit Arya, in connection with the murder of 19-year-old receptionist Ankita Bhandari who worked at Pulkit's resort. Pulkit has been arrested along with two staff members. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami announced setting up an SIT to probe the incident.

249.title: I was crushed after a troll said I bought my State Award: Dulquer
249.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that a troll once told him, 'Hey, want to sell your (State) Award? I will pay you 500 bucks more than what you paid for it.' He added that he was crushed at the time. Dulquer won the Kerala State Award in 2016. "[Someone] told me...'Do not ever not enjoy [your awards]'," the actor added.

250.title: Set up cardiac support facility on court premises: HC to Delhi govt
250.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the national capital's government to install advanced cardiac life support (ACLS) facility on its premises before December 6. The court gave the order in a 2018 suo motu petition on basic life support system requirements in public places. Moreover, the court directed Delhi Metro to set up ACLS facilities at all major interchange stations.

251.title: Why confuse Rahul and cloud his imagination?: Shastri on Kohli opening
251.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli potentially opening the innings in the T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "I wouldn't want that...KL Rahul is batting beautifully at the top." "Why cloud his imagination? Why confuse him? Why sow a seed in his mind that he might not be opening? You don't want that," added Shastri.

252.title: SP shares videos of BJP MLAs playing game, eating tobacco inside Assembly
252.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) tweeted two videos taken inside the UP Assembly. In one of the videos, Mahoba BJP MLA Rakesh Goswami can be seen playing a mobile game inside the Assembly and in another, Jhansi BJP MLA Ravi Sharma can be seen eating tobacco. "These people don't have answers to citizens' issues...turned the Assembly into an entertainment hub," SP wrote.

253.title: 38-yr-old man murders 75-yr-old man after fight over sharing food in Nagpur
253.article_body: A 38-year-old man killed a 75-year-old man after two fought over sharing food in Nagpur. An official said that the two had earlier consumed liquor at the spot. Following the fight, the accused hit the victim on the head using a wooden stick and killed him. The accused has confessed to killing the man.

254.title: The big openings of 'Sanju', 'Brahmāstra' are not because of me: Ranbir
254.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has stated that the opening numbers of 'Sanju' and 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' are not because of him. "I have that much sense that...'Sanju'...was a Rajkumar Hirani film, it was a biopic on Sanjay Dutt. That's really a star-proof, actor-proof setup...'Brahmāstra'...had Alia and my pairing, Nag sir. It had so much going for it," he said.

255.title: Pant should play orthodox cricket, he's been lost in experiments: Hayden
255.article_body: Ex-Australia opener Matthew Hayden said he'd like to see Rishabh Pant play more orthodox cricket, adding he's been "lost in experiments" for a long time. Hayden stated that he'd pick Pant over Dinesh Karthik in India's lineup for T20 World Cup 2022. "It's so key to have power hitters...who can hit the ball long. Pant's got that versatility," he said.

256.title: Nitish not PM candidate but facilitator in uniting Oppn: JD(U) chief
256.article_body: JD(U) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is not a PM candidate and that he only wants to be a facilitator in uniting the Opposition. "With the unity of...Opposition, India can be free from BJP," Singh added. He also criticised BJP for misusing central agencies, claiming that the party is ending the trustworthiness of established institutions.

257.title: UP policeman gets life term for shooting lawyer dead on court premises
257.article_body: A 43-year-old Sub-Inspector was sentenced to life imprisonment on Friday for shooting a lawyer dead on the premises of an Allahabad court in 2015. According to the prosecution, Shailendra Singh shot advocate Nabi Ahmed following an altercation. Another accused, Rashid Siddique, who was booked on charges of criminal conspiracy, was acquitted by the Raebareli court.

258.title: Railways gets real-time train tracking system built with ISRO help
258.article_body: Indian Railways on Friday said it is installing a Real-Time Train Information System (RTIS) on locomotives to track their movement. The system, built in collaboration with the ISRO, is capable of providing "mid-section updates with a periodicity of 30 seconds", and tracking location and speed of trains without any manual intervention. The RTIS devices have been installed in 2,700 locomotives.

259.title: Manmohan Singh extraordinary but India stalled during UPA-era: Narayana Murthy
259.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy recently spoke about delays in decision-making during the Congress-led UPA's regime. He said, "I used to be on the board of HSBC in London (between 2008 and 2012)...During Manmohan Singh's government, who's an extraordinary individual, for whom I have tremendous respect, somehow India stalled. Decisions were not taken quickly, everything was delayed."

260.title: Barclays sued by shareholders over $17.6 bn debt sale blunder in US
260.article_body: Barclays' shareholders sued the British lender in a proposed US class action claiming they had suffered losses in connection with the bank's sale of $17.6 billion more debt than regulators had allowed. The authorised amount was $20.8 billion. Barclays revealed in March that it sold $15.2 billion more structured and exchange-traded notes, which was raised by $2.4 billion in July.

261.title: UP testing ground for every scheme formulated by Centre: Yogi
261.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that with a population of 24-25 crores, the state acts as a testing ground for every scheme formulated by the Centre. "If any welfare programme bears positive results in Uttar Pradesh, it's set to have a positive impact on all...other states," he added. Adityanath was addressing a conclave in Lucknow.

262.title: U'khand CM orders probe by SIT after 19-yr-old receptionist's body found in canal
262.article_body: After the body of a missing 19-year-old receptionist, at former Uttarakhand minister and BJP leader Vinod Arya's son's resort, was recovered from a canal on Saturday, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said that he is "pained by the heartbreaking incident". The Chief Minister said that a Special Investigation Team has been formed and an in-depth probe has been ordered.

263.title: AR Rahman, Aishwarya Rai travel in economy to promote 'Ponniyin Selvan: I'
263.article_body: Composer AR Rahman and actors Aishwarya Rai, Vikram and Trisha Krishnan flew from Hyderabad to Mumbai for the promotions of Mani Ratnam's directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. They could be seen travelling in the economy class of the plane. A social media user commented, "How come this isn't business class or a private jet?" while another wrote, "We love a budget."

264.title: 21-hour Haryana highway blockade ends after farmers' demands met
264.article_body: Farmers in Haryana on Saturday morning lifted the blockade on the Delhi-Ambala National Highway near Shahabad in Haryana's Kurukshetra after their demands were met, Bhartiya Kisan Union (Haryana) chief said. The farmers had blocked the highway for over 21 hours. "We had talks with the district administration and they've ensured that paddy procurement will start immediately," the BKU chief added.

265.title: Sachin Pilot only alternative after Ashok Gehlot as Raj CM: Congress MLA
265.article_body: Congress MLA Rajendra Singh Gudha has come out in support of Sachin Pilot for the post of Rajasthan Chief Minister. "In my understanding, after Gehlot sahab, there is no alternative in Rajasthan apart from Sachin Pilot sahab," he told reporters on Friday. Gudha, who along with five other BSP MLAs switched to Congress in 2019, also met Pilot on Saturday.

266.title: Lost peace of mind, wish I hadn't won so much money: Kerala auto driver on ₹25cr lottery
266.article_body: Days after winning a ₹25-crore lottery in Kerala, auto-rickshaw driver Anoop said, "I've lost all peace of mind." He said he's being mobbed by people seeking financial help and asking him to sort out their various needs. "I have to keep changing houses...I haven't even got the money. I now wish I had not got so much money," he added.

267.title: SRK's role in 'Brahmāstra' had Iron Man-like tonality: Ayan Mukerji
267.article_body: Speaking about Shah Rukh Khan's role in 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', Ayan Mukerji said, "The tonality of that scene is a little bit Iron Man-like." He added that they always thought Vanarastra will exist in the world of science which is why the character is a scientist. "Shah Rukh Khan is kind of a hero cracking jokes," he said.

268.title: Man stuck between train & platform rescued in TN; video goes viral
268.article_body: A video of a man being rescued by Railway Protection Force (RPF) officers and Government Railway Police officials after he got stuck between a train and the platform at Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore railway station has gone viral. The video was shared by RPF India on its Twitter handle with the caption, "Yet another story of Bravery and Courage!"

269.title: SC to hear BJP MP Manoj Tiwari's plea on firecrackers ban on Oct 10
269.article_body: Supreme Court will hear a plea filed by BJP MP Manoj Tiwari against the Delhi government's decision on the firecrackers ban on October 10. "In the name of the Right to life, freedom of religion cannot be taken away," Tiwari's plea said. Delhi government banned the storage, sale and use of all types of firecrackers till January 1, 2023.

270.title: IndiGo charges Olympic medalist PR Sreejesh for 41-inch hockey stick, he shares post
270.article_body: Indian men's hockey team goalkeeper PR Sreejesh, who was a part of the team that won a bronze medal at the Tokyo Olympics, took to Twitter after IndiGo charged him extra for his baggage. He tweeted, "FIH [allows] me to play with a 41-inch hockey stick, but IndiGo never [allows] me to carry anything over 38-inch...Pay extra ₹1500 for...goalkeeper baggage."

271.title: Irrfan Khan was very kind to actors, he was chill: Dulquer Salmaan
271.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan recently spoke about late actor Irrfan Khan, saying that he was very kind to actors. He added that actors can be selfish and only care about getting their scenes right but Irrfan was "chill". "He will be like 'Hey, I might just say something here' [or] 'I might throw something here...giving you a heads up'," Dulquer said.

272.title: Elephant’s ivory teeth only for show: Digvijaya Singh on RSS chief
272.article_body: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat’s visit to a madrassa in Delhi, Congress leader Digvijaya Singh compared his meeting with the ivory teeth of elephants, which are only for show. "Wherever innocent Muslims have been persecuted by your workers, apologise to them and get them justice. Then only, we will believe that the RSS is thinking differently," said Singh.

273.title: No Change of Guard Ceremony today due to weather: Rashtrapati Bhavan
273.article_body: The Change Of Guard ceremony, which takes place every Saturday at the forecourt of Rashtrapati Bhavan, will not take place today due to inclement weather conditions. The change of guard ceremony is a military tradition that is held every week to enable a fresh group of the President's bodyguards to take the charge.

274.title: Being outsider in Bollywood helped me not get carried away: Sonali
274.article_body: Speaking about being an outsider in Bollywood, actress Sonali Bendre said that she was used to being an outsider because of being born into an Army family. "It also kept me grounded because I didn't get so carried away with what was happening to me," she added. The actress further said that it was easier to adapt to new situations.

275.title: First pic of UK King Charles carrying out duties with official 'Red Box' released
275.article_body: UK King Charles has been pictured with his official Red Box in which the British monarch receives government documents. The photo was released by the Buckingham Palace along with the old pictures showing Queen Elizabeth II with the Red Boxes. "Queen Elizabeth received Red Boxes, which were made upon her Coronation in 1952, almost every day," the statement read.

276.title: 30 students fall sick after eating food in mess at Pune university
276.article_body: About 30 students at Pune's MIT Art, Design and Technology (ADT) University fell sick after allegedly eating food from the mess on the campus. The university's officials denied the allegations and claimed that the students had eaten food outside the campus which led to the illness. The registrar said that students who fell sick have minor food poisoning symptoms.

277.title: Wipro announces annual increment for employees, covers 96% staff
277.article_body: Wipro announced an annual increment to eligible employees for the financial year ended March 2022 and they will get it with their September salaries. The firm has covered around 96% of employees under this round of annual increments. Wipro had held back variable pay to its mid and senior-level executives for the June quarter due to pressure on operating margins.

278.title: Faith in judiciary vindicated: Uddhav on Dussehra rally permission
278.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday welcomed the Bombay High Court's order which allowed his faction to hold the annual Dussehra rally in Mumbai's Shivaji Park on October 5. Adding that it's the state government's responsibility to maintain law and order during the rally, he further said, "Our faith in the judiciary stands vindicated."

279.title: BYJU'S clears $234 million payment to Blackstone for Aakash deal: Report
279.article_body: BYJU'S has paid $234 million to Blackstone it owed to the private-equity firm for the $950 million acquisition of Aakash, as per a report. The payment was for a stake of about 38% owned by Blackstone in Aakash. While closing the deal, BYJU'S had reportedly paid all Aakash's shareholders, except Blackstone as the firm had agreed on deferred payment.

280.title: I don't read reviews, don't like dissection of films: Alia Bhatt
280.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt stated that she doesn't read film reviews even when they are good, adding she reads the headlines people send her sometimes. She added she doesn't like "this sort of dissection on day one or day 10 also of a film". "You generally get a sense of what worked and what didn't after the film's release," she said.

281.title: Cryptocurrency exchange ZebPay's CEO quits, to start own venture
281.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange ZebPay's CEO Avinash Shekhar has resigned from his post and will now work on his own startup, which will operate in the Web 3.0 and crypto tax compliance space. According to Shekhar's LinkedIn profile, he started working with ZebPay in July 2017 as CFO before becoming the Co-CEO and later the CEO in December 2021.

282.title: Woman who accused BJP leader of rape gets 1 week to file documents
282.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday granted a week's time to file documents to a woman who has accused BJP leader and former Union minister Shahnawaz Hussain of raping her. Some "material facts" relating to the alleged offence have been concealed by the BJP leader's counsel, the woman's lawyer claimed. "We will list the matter on October 12 for hearing," SC said.

283.title: Supreme Court's online RTI portal almost ready: Justice Chandrachud
283.article_body: The Supreme Court will soon have an online RTI portal, assured a bench headed by Justice DY Chandrachud on Friday. "The portal is almost ready," said Chandrachud while hearing a PIL seeking a mechanism to file RTI applications online. Calling it a valuable thing, the judge further said the move can be emulated by the high courts.

284.title: Star kids like Varun Dhawan, Suhana Khan work really hard: Juhi Chawla
284.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla said that star kids like Varun Dhawan and Suhana Khan work really hard. "None of them takes it lightly that I am a star kid so I'll just arrive on sets and things will happen," she added. The actress further said that she can never say who is her favourite because she has seen them growing up.

285.title: 45-yr-old man dies of electrocution on waterlogged road in Gurugram
285.article_body: A 45-year-old man died after getting electrocuted by a live wire protruding from an electric pole in Gurugram on Thursday night. According to police, Swami Chopra couldn't spot a pit on the road due to waterlogging and drove into it. He then fell into the ditch and got electrocuted by the wire, police added. Chopra was a resident of Sector-37D.

286.title: Punjab Guv seeks Assembly session details; CM says, 'It's too much'
286.article_body: After Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit's office sought details of legislative business to be taken up during an Assembly session called by state government on September 27, state CM Bhagwant Mann said, "[It's] too much." "[Governor/President's] consent before any session of legislature is...formality. In 75 years, no President/Governor ever asked [for] list of legislative business," Mann added.

287.title: After day's rest, Rahul Gandhi resumes Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala
287.article_body: After a day's rest, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday resumed the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra from Kerala's Perambra. The 17th day of the 'yatra' started around 6:30 am and the night stay will be at Thope Stadium. On Friday, a medical camp was organised at Chalakudy for those participating in the march.

288.title: Country claiming to seek peace won't shelter 26/11 attack planners: India to Pak at UN
288.article_body: India has criticised Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif for his remarks at the UNGA. The first secretary of the Indian Mission to the UN, Mijito Vinito said, "A polity that claims it seeks peace with...neighbours would never sponsor cross-border terrorism…Nor would it shelter planners of the horrific Mumbai terrorist attack, disclosing their existence only under pressure from the international community."

289.title: Influencer facing 6 yrs jail in Russia for using Instagram; shares pic of her crying
289.article_body: Russian fashion influencer Veronika Loginova has said she's facing six years in jail for using Instagram. According to Russian digital rights NGO Roskomsvoboda, the 18-year-old is the first individual to be prosecuted after a Russian court banned Instagram and Facebook for "extremist" activities in March. She posted pictures of her crying and documents allegedly sent to her by Russian prosecutors.

290.title: 3 arrested for shooting at man, robbing delivery boy in south Delhi
290.article_body: Police have arrested three men for allegedly shooting and injuring a person, minutes before they robbed a food delivery boy of his bike and cellphone in south Delhi's Neb Sarai area on Thursday. According to police, the men shot the victim over some previous enmity. Police also recovered a pistol, knife and the stolen bike and cellphone from the accused.

291.title: Roads waterlogged, trees uprooted in Delhi after heavy rains; IMD issues yellow alert
291.article_body: The India Meteorological Department issued a 'yellow' alert for Delhi on Saturday. The Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter to share a list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging in the city. The police also said that trees have been uprooted in several areas including areas near Shivaji Stadium, Dilshad Garden and Kalkaji main road.

292.title: 5 arrested over fine on Dalit family for touching idol in Karnataka
292.article_body: Police arrested five people for imposing a fine of ₹60,000 on a 15-year-old Dalit boy's family for touching an idol of a village deity in Kolar. The boy had touched the idol during a religious procession on September 8, police said. "We will offer our prayers to Dr BR Ambedkar," the boy's mother had said earlier.

293.title: Man dies after half of his body gets stuck in Chandigarh garbage vehicle
293.article_body:
A man died after half of his body got stuck in the twin-bin garbage vehicle of the Chandigarh Municipal Corporation. Reports said that the deceased was scheduled to get married on October 2. 
Om Prakash Saini, chairman of Door-to-door Waste Collectors Society, said, "A family is ruined...a mother lost her only son...How can the civic body shrug off its responsibility?"

294.title: India reports 4,912 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity stands at 1.62%
294.article_body: India reported 4,912 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,383 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in the country now stand at 44,436 following 5,719 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.62%.

295.title: 2 women save each other's husbands' lives by donating kidneys in Delhi
295.article_body: The lives of two men in Delhi could be saved as part of a 'swap transplant' after their wives' blood groups matched with each other's husbands. Both the men had been advised to undergo kidney transplants. However, their respective wives could not donate their kidneys to them due to the incompatibility of blood groups.

296.title: Body of 19-yr-old missing resort receptionist recovered from U'khand canal
296.article_body: The body of a missing 19-year-old receptionist at former Uttarakhand minister and BJP leader Vinod Arya's son's resort has been recovered from a canal in Rishikesh, a State Disaster Response Force spokesperson confirmed. Three people, including the son, were arrested for Ankita Bhandari's murder. The accused confessed that Ankita drowned when they pushed her into the canal, police earlier said.

297.title: Our nationalism doesn't pose any threat to others: RSS chief
297.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Friday said, "Our nationalism does not pose any threat [to] others." "Our nationalism prescribes that the world is one family. Therefore, there can't be a Hitler in India and if there would be any, the people of the country would pull him down," he added. Bhagwat was speaking at a programme organised by Sankalp Foundation.

298.title: ED files plea seeking medical examination of Nawab Malik
298.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has approached the special PMLA court to constitute a medical board to verify the health condition of NCP leader Nawab Malik, who has been admitted at a private hospital in Mumbai for over four months. Malik was arrested by ED on February 23 in connection with a money laundering case.

299.title: Thrashed for cheating in exam, 12-year-old UP boy dies by suicide
299.article_body: A 12-year-old boy in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli was found hanging at home hours after allegedly getting thrashed by a teacher for cheating during an exam on Thursday. A note was recovered, said police. An FIR was filed against the school principal and a teacher after a complaint by the victim's father. The school authorities have denied the allegations.

300.title: Firms shouldn't pin employees & put a lid on their dreams: Union Minister on 'Moonlighting'
300.article_body: Union Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar while speaking about 'Moonlighting' said, "Companies shouldn't pin their employees and put a lid on their dreams." He added, "Today's youngsters have every sense of confidence...about monetizing and creating more value to his or her own skills." Recently, Wipro fired 300 employees who were found to be 'Moonlighting' for competitors.

301.title: Resort of BJP leader's son demolished at midnight in Rishikesh after receptionist's murder
301.article_body: The resort of BJP leader and former Uttarakhand minister Vinod Arya's son Pulkit was demolished late at night in Rishikesh after he, along with two others, was arrested for allegedly murdering its 19-year-old receptionist. The accused have confessed to pushing her into a canal after a personal dispute, following which she drowned, police said.

302.title: I'd be awkward playing Salman's bhabhi, mom after starring opposite him: Ayesha
302.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka said she would feel awkward if she had to play bhabhi or mother of actor Salman Khan or any of her co-actors after starring opposite them in a film. "I'd rather not do it. But if there is a character which is strong...convincing and...author-backed, I would obviously do it. Then I wouldn't think about it," she added.

303.title: Congress has no moral right to talk about corruption: K'taka CM
303.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised the Congress and said that the party has no moral right to talk about corruption. "The BJP released a book on the corruption of the Congress and [despite] being corrupt they are doing an abhiyan on corruption," said Bommai. He went on to say that the attitude of talking without evidence would not last long.

304.title: Man jailed for selling fake educational certificates in Hyderabad
304.article_body: A 42-year-old man was jailed under the Preventive Detention Act for allegedly creating and selling fake educational certificates in Hyderabad. He was arrested earlier this month and items such as fake educational certificates of various educational institutes, rubber stamps, laptops and printers were seized. The police said he is a habitual offender who has been committing the crime since 2002.

305.title: Labourer dies after lift at construction site collapses on him in Mumbai
305.article_body: A labourer was killed after a temporary lift collapsed and fell on him at a construction site in Mumbai's Borivali, police said. According to reports, the deceased was working at the site when the material was being transferred from the 14th floor to the 15th floor of the building. According to police, five people have been arrested in the case.

306.title: Fire at auto parts godown in Vadodara; 56 employees help fire fighters
306.article_body: A fire broke out at an automobile spare parts godown in Gujarat's Vadodara on Thursday night. "Over 56 employees...11 fire tenders working to douse the flames," an official said. "It has two-wheeler parts like tyres and oil which are highly flammable. No casualty yet, units placed across the area so we may cover areas one by one," the official added.

307.title: Family keeps man's dead body at home for 18 months in Kanpur thinking he's in coma
307.article_body: The family of an Income Tax Department employee, who died last year, allegedly kept his body at home in Kanpur for almost 18 months assuming he was in a coma. As per officials, his wife would sprinkle 'gangajal' on him daily hoping he would come out of the coma. He died in April 2021 due to sudden cardiac respiratory syndrome.

308.title: Class 2 student dies after falling unconscious at school in Delhi
308.article_body: A Class 2 student died after he fell unconscious at a Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) primary co-ed school in Rohini. The child was immediately taken to a hospital where he was provided first aid and his parents were called, however, the child's situation kept getting critical, an official said. "It is a completely unexpected case," an MCD official said.

309.title: BMC releases ₹5 lakh extra fund for each ward to fill potholes
309.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has allotted an additional fund of ₹5 lakh each to all the 24 municipal wards of Mumbai to fill potholes in their respective jurisdictions. Ward officers will use the funds to buy cold-mix from the open market for filling the potholes. The funds will be handled by BMC engineers for emergency purposes, an official said.

310.title: PMPML to install 148 boom barriers on BRT corridors
310.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has decided to install 148 boom barriers on Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) corridors in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad to stop the movement of unwanted general vehicles. This comes following a successful trial run of four automatic boom barriers in March. "BRT corridor is specially for PMPML buses and emergency vehicles," a PMPML official said.

311.title: Pune Police arrests foreign national with mephedrone worth ₹7.19 lakh
311.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 22-year-old foreign national for selling 51 grams of mephedrone drug worth ₹7.19 lakh. The anti-narcotics cell of the city police arrested the accused after receiving a tip-off that he will be arriving in Wanowrie. The accused was involved in peddling drugs and the source of mephedrone was being investigated, an investigative officer said.

312.title: Rainwater enters Gurugram houses, people forced to shift to upper floors
312.article_body: As heavy rains lashed Gurugram and adjoining areas on Friday, rainwater entered houses and basements, reports said, adding that several people were forced to shift to upper floors. According to reports, DLF Phase 1, Sushant Lok-1, Old Gurugram, and Sectors 4, 5, 7, 14, 46 and 56 were among worst affected areas. Residents also put up sandbags outside their homes.

313.title: 2 women rescued from brothel in Hyderabad, 2 traffickers detained
313.article_body: Two women were rescued after police raided a house in Hyderabad's Peerzadiguda based on inputs of a brothel being run there. The police detained two persons, Thotakura Srilatha Reddy and Perumandla Shankar, for allegedly running brothel houses in Medipally by luring women and girls into prostitution. Srilatha was earlier caught running a brothel house in the same area.

314.title: Video of Rafael Nadal crying during Roger Federer's farewell goes viral, fans react
314.article_body: A video of Rafael Nadal crying during Roger Federer's farewell has went viral. Following Federer and Nadal's doubles match in Laver Cup, Nadal was seen in tears on separate occasions, including during Federer's speech. "A moment in sporting history I can't and won't ever forget," a fan tweeted. "This is when you know...tennis is secondary to the friendship," wrote another.

315.title: Amazon cuts raises for staff after technical error miscalculates their bonuses
315.article_body: Amazon informed its recently promoted corporate employees that a technical error caused their bonuses to be overstated, due to which they will now receive a lower "promotional cash value" than what was initially promised. The bonuses had reportedly been calculated using older, higher stock prices and about 40% of promoted employees this quarter were affected by the error.

316.title: Businessman driving Jaguar with 2-wheeler's number plate booked in Mumbai; pic surfaces
316.article_body: A Mumbai businessman has been booked for allegedly driving a Jaguar for five years bearing the number plate of a two-wheeler belonging to someone else. The owner of the two-wheeler, Rahul Rai, reportedly received 11 e-challans for traffic violations purportedly committed by the businessman, Adnan Ahmed Syed. The accused claimed the number plate maker had committed the error, police said.

317.title: Roger Federer breaks down after his career's last-ever match, pics go viral
317.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer broke down after his career's last-ever match at the Laver Cup in London. The 41-year-old was seen getting emotional as he greeted his Team Europe teammates, opponents and fans following the doubles match, in which he teamed up with Rafael Nadal. "We'll get through this, won't we?" Federer said during the interview.

318.title: Protester invades court during Laver Cup match, sets his arm on fire; pic goes viral
318.article_body: A protester invaded the court and lit a portion of the court and his arm on fire during Team Europe's Stefanos Tsitsipas' Laver Cup match against Team World's Diego Schwartzman at London's O2 Arena. The protester was seen wearing a t-shirt which read, "End UK Private Jets". The protester eventually extinguished the fire by shaking his arm and was detained.

319.title: BCCI criticised after India-Australia T20I gets shortened despite no rain on match day
319.article_body: The BCCI has been criticised after second India-Australia T20I in Nagpur got shortened due to wet outfield despite no rain on match day. "Richest board but no proper drainage system," a Twitter user wrote. "Why can't stadium authorities be better prepared?" wrote another. "At some point the administrators need to be held accountable," another tweet read.

320.title: Bengaluru reports 158 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
320.article_body: Bengaluru reported 158 new COVID-19 infections on Friday, taking the cumulative case count to 18,71,055, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,241, while the infection positivity rate stood at 1.55%.

321.title: Man's body found in underground water tank in Delhi's Connaught Place
321.article_body: A highly decomposed body of a man who seemed to be around 40 years of age was recovered from an underground water tank in Delhi's Connaught Place, police said. This comes after the maintenance staff of water tanks of the fire department came to clean the tank, police added. They found the lock of the tank broken, police stated.

322.title: Nicholas Latifi to leave Williams Racing at end of 2022 F1 season
322.article_body: Williams Racing have confirmed that their driver Nicholas Latifi will leave the team at the end of the 2022 F1 season. "He is a great team player who has a great attitude," said CEO Jost Capito. Latifi, who has been with the team for almost three years, said he and the team had "not achieved the results" they hoped for.

323.title: Seeking a juvenile's confession is unconstitutional: Delhi HC
323.article_body: The Delhi HC said seeking a confession from a juvenile is unconstitutional as a "presumption is raised at the pre-trial stage itself" against the child. It added that securing a juvenile's confession is beyond the scope of preliminary assessment to be prepared under the Juvenile Justice Act. The bench is hearing a plea on issuing guidelines for Juvenile Justice Boards.

324.title: Mini IPL 2023 auction on Dec 16, DC approach CSK for Jadeja: Report
324.article_body: A one-day mini-auction for IPL 2023 is reportedly set to take place on December 16. Franchises are said to have a purse of 95 crores for the mini-auction with November end being the deadline for retained and released players' list from each team. Meanwhile, Delhi Capitals have reportedly approached CSK with a trade request for all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja.

325.title: PM Modi should meet leaders from other parties more: Venkaiah Naidu
325.article_body: Former Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said PM Narendra Modi should more often meet political leadership from all sides which may help clear some "misunderstandings" about his methods. "Over a period of time these misunderstandings will also be cleared," said Naidu. He added that political parties should also keep an open mind and respect the mandate of the people.

326.title: Pakistani wrestler Ali Asad stripped of CWG medal after testing positive for banned drugs
326.article_body: Pakistani wrestler Ali Asad, who claimed bronze medal for his country in the 57kg category in the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, was stripped of his medal after testing positive for banned performance-enhancing drugs. The Pakistan Sports Board (PSB) has also withheld his prize money. "I am surprised at how I have been declared positive," Ali Asad said.

327.title: Jose Mourinho, Usain Bolt among celebs in Stormzy's new music video
327.article_body: Roma manager Jose Mourinho and Olympic gold medallist Usain Bolt are among celebrities who have appeared in rapper Stormzy's new music video. The video also has some of Mourinho's iconic public dialogues like, "I prefer not to speak. If I speak, I will be in big trouble." Actor Idris Elba and comedian Jonathan Ross are also in the video.

328.title: Delhi records 95 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
328.article_body: Delhi on Friday reported 95 new COVID-19 cases and one death due to the infection, as per the city health department. The national capital recorded a daily positivity rate of 0.96%. With the new cases, the city's active case count stood at 430, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi on Thursday had logged 77 cases of the viral disease.

329.title: WWE's Paige joins AEW 4 years after retiring from in-ring wrestling
329.article_body: Saraya Jade Bevis, popularly known as WWE superstar Paige, has joined All Elite Wrestling (AEW) and will reportedly be competing as an active in-ring performer named 'Saraya'. Bevis suffered a neck injury during a WWE match in 2017 and announced her retirement at the age of 25. She has recently said she is fit to begin performing again.

330.title: 4 Ukrainian regions begin voting on whether they will join Russia
330.article_body: Four Ukrainian regions, which are mostly under Russian military occupation, began voting on Friday on whether to join Russia. Russian President Vladimir Putin has indicated the regions will be annexed if the local people vote in favour to join Russia. The voting, which will end on Tuesday, is taking place in Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia.

331.title: I was a ball girl at Eden Gardens in 1997, decided then to play for Ind: Jhulan
331.article_body: Indian seamer Jhulan Goswami recalled the incident when she decided to play for the country. "In 1997, I was a ball girl at the Eden Gardens where I saw my first women's World Cup final. From that day, my dream was to represent India," Goswami said. Notably, the 1997 women's WC final was played between Australia and New Zealand.

332.title: Punjab BJP chief meets Captain Amarinder Singh
332.article_body: BJP's Punjab state president Ashwani Sharma met former Punjab CM, Captain Amarinder Singh, at the latter's residence on Friday. This was the first meeting between the two leaders since Singh joined BJP on Monday. "The BJP leaders discussed the prevailing political scenario in Punjab and the future course of action of the party," the party's statement said.

333.title: Rijiju visits construction site of second Kolia Bhomora bridge in Assam
333.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Friday visited the construction site of the second Kolia Bhomora bridge over Brahmaputra river in Assam's Sonitpur district. The bridge will play an important role for the army in facilitating communication to the northeastern border, Rijiju said. The three km-long bridge will connect Sonitpur on the north bank with Nagaon on the south bank.

334.title: Woman kidnapped & gang-raped for 36 days in Raj, her family paid ₹3 lakh for her release
334.article_body: A Haryana woman was allegedly kidnapped and kept captive in a Rajasthan village for 36 days, during which she was gang-raped multiple times, police said. The 45-year-old survivor's family also paid ₹3 lakh to the accused to secure her release, officials said. The accused allegedly demanded the money to not release objectionable videos that they shot of her.

335.title: Messi, he's an unselfish player: Arsenal's Saka on whom he'd like to play with
335.article_body: On being asked whom he would like to play with, Arsenal winger Bukayo Saka said Lionel Messi. "I think he has an unbelievable quality, he can score and assist...he's an unselfish player and a team player, so yeah I would choose him," he added. Notably, the 21-year-old has been voted England Men's 'Player of the Year' for 2021-2022.

336.title: Spinners will play big part in T20 World Cup: Muttiah Muralitharan
336.article_body: Former Sri Lankan spinner Muttiah Muralitharan said that the "spinners will play a big part" in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "I think India got enough spinners to bowl on those pitches," Muralitharan said. He added, "I think anyone can win the World Cup...Australia might have a slight edge because they are playing on their home soil."

337.title: We are living in constant fear: Kapil Sibal
337.article_body: Former Union Minister Kapil Sibal said that people in India are living in "constant fear". "Whole populations are afraid and they get mentally ghettoised...We fear everybody. We don't have any trust in anybody," Sibal said. "The real problem is, in India today those who are part of the hate speech are the collaborators of a particular ideology," he added.

338.title: Quad nations sign Humanitarian Assistance Disaster Relief Guidelines
338.article_body: Members of the four-nation Quadrilateral Security Dialogue or the Quad signed the Humanitarian Assistance Disaster Relief Guidelines during a meeting of their foreign ministers in New York on Friday. Secretary of State, US, Antony Blinken said the meeting was evidence that the grouping was becoming stronger. The Quad grouping was formed in 2017, comprising India, Japan, Australia and the US.

339.title: 4 of a family, including children, drown in nullah in J&K's Udhampur
339.article_body: Four members of a family, including children, drowned in a nullah in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district on Friday, officials said. The deceased, who had gone to fetch water and grass for their cattle, fell in the nullah and drowned, they said. The deceased were identified as 16-year-old Nishu Devi, 22-year-old Anju Devi, 24-year-old Yash Pal and 12-year-old Meenakshi.

340.title: Booker Prize-winning author Hilary Mantel dies aged 70
340.article_body: Booker Prize-winning author Hilary Mantel has died, publishing company HarperCollins said on Friday. Mantel was 70. HarperCollins described her as "one of the greatest English novelists of this century". Mantel had been awarded the Booker Prize on two occasions, first in 2009 for "Wolf Hall" and again in 2012 for its sequel "Bring Up The Bodies".

341.title: Foreign ministers of US, China meet amidst tensions over Taiwan
341.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on the sidelines of a UN General Assembly session in New York on Friday. The US State Department said the meeting was a part of efforts to "maintain open lines of communication". Tensions between the two sides spiked last month after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan.

342.title: India beat Australia as Rohit breaks world record for slamming most T20I sixes, level series
342.article_body: India defeated Australia by six wickets in the second T20I to level the three-match series. Australia put up a total of 90/5 after the match was reduced to eight overs/side amid wet outfield. India chased down the target in 7.2 overs. The match witnessed India captain Rohit Sharma break world record for slamming most sixes in T20I cricket.

343.title: Suhana, Varun don't take things lightly, they work really hard: Juhi
343.article_body: Juhi Chawla in an interview said star kids like Suhana Khan and Varun Dhawan work really hard, adding she likes how these kids don't take things for granted just because of their privilege. "None of them takes it lightly that I'm...star kid so I'll...arrive on sets and things will happen," Juhi said, adding, "A lot of them really work hard."

344.title: I know what's going to go viral, it's disgusting: Ana on nude scenes in Blonde
344.article_body: Hollywood actress Ana De Armas spoke about doing nude scenes in 'Blonde' and said, "I know what's going to go viral, and it's disgusting." "It's upsetting just to think about it. I can't control it; you can't really control what they do and how they take things out of context," she added. The film is directed by Andrew Dominik.

345.title: AAP expels ex-MLA Balwant Singh Mankotia for anti-party activities
345.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday terminated the party membership of former legislator Balwant Singh Mankotia for alleged anti-party activities. The AAP accused Mankotia of influencing party workers to join rival political outfits. Mankotia was the President of the Jammu and Kashmir National Panthers Party before joining the AAP in April.

346.title: One more PFI member arrested by Assam Police; total arrests at 11
346.article_body: Assam Police on Friday arrested Popular Front of India's (PFI) West Bengal unit president Dr Minarul Sheikh, police said. Since Thursday, 11 PFI functionaries have been arrested by the Assam Police. Nationwide raids were carried out against persons linked to the PFI on Thursday for allegedly supporting terror activities. Subsequently, central and state agencies arrested 106 PFI members.

347.title: Moscow 'not threatening' anybody with nukes: Russian minister
347.article_body: Russia's Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov on Friday said Moscow was not threatening anyone with the use of nuclear warheads, adding that open confrontation with the US and NATO was not in Russia's interest. Earlier this week, President Vladimir Putin said that he was "not bluffing" when he said Russia would use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is challenged.

348.title: Sole duty is to take son's custody, not seen him for 15 months: Karan Mehra
348.article_body: TV actor Karan Mehra said he hasn't seen his son Kavish for the past 15 months amid legal battle with his estranged wife, Nisha Rawal.
