"I think I should get my son's custody because, like I said, the environment isn't okay for a child to see all this," Karan said. "I've to get Kavish out...It's my sole duty," he added.

349.title: BJP trying to divide the society, disrupt communal harmony: TRS MLC
349.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Friday criticised the BJP, accusing the party of trying to divide the society and disrupting communal harmony. "BJP should look at the leadership of CM KCR who respects and celebrates all the religions alike in the state," she said. Addressing a gathering of women, she urged them to question BJP about price rise and unemployment.

350.title: 500 arrested, 400 detained as PFI protests turn violent in Kerala
350.article_body: As many as 500 people were arrested and 400 people were detained after protests by the Popular Front of India (PFI) turned violent in Kerala. As per reports, around 50 state-run buses were damaged. Further, a bomb was hurled at Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) office in Mattanur. Police said few people were arrested while carrying a bomb.

351.title: Fake: PIB on reports that trees were cut for PM Modi's visit to Kuno
351.article_body: The report on the felling of trees to make arrangements for PM Narendra Modi's recent visit to Kuno National Park is "fake", Press Information Bureau (PIB) said. Trees were cut to make helipads and pitch tents for VIPs, the report claimed. PIB tweeted, "No trees were cut...Lodging arrangements were made at Sesaipura FRH and Tourism Jungle Lodge."

352.title: Pakistan's bowling is not as strong as we think: Inzamam-ul-Haq
352.article_body: Speaking about Pakistan's bowling performance, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq stated Babar Azam-led side's bowling is not as strong as it seems. "We've speedsters who can bowl at 140 km/hr, but since Shaheen Shah Afridi's absence, we've only bowled well in small parts and not full 20 overs," he added. Pakistan beat England by 10 wickets in second T20I.

353.title: Rohit Sharma breaks world record for smashing most sixes in T20I cricket
353.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has broken the world record for smashing the most number of sixes in T20I cricket. With his first six in the second T20I against Australia on Friday, Rohit took his tally of sixes in T20I cricket to 173. He overtook the tally of New Zealand's Martin Guptill, who has hit 172 sixes in 117 T20I innings.

354.title: Working on SC suggestions to help Ukraine-return students: Centre
354.article_body: The Centre on Friday said it is working on the Supreme Court's (SC) suggestions to assist medical students, who returned from Ukraine without completing their courses. The SC earlier suggested a portal be created to assist these students in finding alternate universities. The Centre said secretaries of the ministries of external affairs and health have been informed of the issue.

355.title: 7 killed, 40 injured in explosion near mosque in Kabul
355.article_body: An explosion near a mosque in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Friday claimed the lives of at least seven people and injured more than 40 others, the city police said. The explosion occurred after the conclusion of Friday prayers, as per the police. Notably, the Islamic State (IS) has claimed responsibility for various such attacks in recent months.

356.title: Cristiano Ronaldo charged by FA for smashing young fan's phone
356.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has been charged by the Football Association (FA) for smashing a young fan's phone following Manchester United's defeat against Everton at Goodison Park in April. Ronaldo had issued an apology after the video of the incident went viral. "We'll be supporting [Ronaldo] in response to the charge," Manchester United said in a statement.

357.title: Legislators skipping committee meetings not acceptable: WB Speaker
357.article_body: West Bengal Legislative Assembly Speaker Biman Banerjee has criticised legislators who are not attending meetings of the Assembly Standing Committees. He alleged some legislators were just signing the attendance sheets to collect allowances but were not attending the meetings. "This is unacceptable...The standing committee meetings are held to discuss and deliberate important issues," he said.

358.title: Respond to plea on fraudulent religious conversions: SC to Centre
358.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday sought the Centre's response to a plea which sought stringent steps against fraudulent religious conversions. A bench of Justices Krishna Murari and MR Shah notified the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Law and Justice, apart from the Union of India. The apex court asked the parties to reply by November 14.

359.title: Woman gives birth on roadside, walks 2 km with baby to reach ambulance in Odisha
359.article_body: A tribal woman reportedly gave birth on roadside and walked 2 kilometres with newborn to the ambulance in Odisha's Koraput. The ambulance was on its way to pick up the woman in labour when it got stuck in mud near the village. So, she had to walk towards the ambulance, but she fell midway and delivered the baby on roadside.

360.title: Cristiano Ronaldo charged by FA for smashing young fan's phone
360.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has been charged by the Football Association (FA) for smashing a young fan's phone following Manchester United's defeat against Everton at Goodison Park in April. Ronaldo had issued an apology after the video of the incident went viral last year. "We'll be supporting [Ronaldo] in response to the charge," Manchester United said in a statement.

361.title: I wanted X-factor in spin department: Manjrekar on India's T20 WC squad
361.article_body: Commenting on India's 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "I've always wanted the X-factor in the spin department and that's the only thing that concerns me." He added, "Axar Patel, Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. The three spinners. I don't see drama happening in the middle overs which you need to win T20I games."

362.title: Akshay Kumar sells Andheri flat for ₹6 crore to music director Daboo Malik: Report
362.article_body: Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar has sold his Andheri flat for ₹6 crore to music director Daboo Malik and wife Jyoti Malik, as per a report. Akshay had bought this property in November 2017 for ₹4.12 crore, the report added. The flat is spread across carpet area of 1,281 sq ft and has a 59-sq ft balcony, the report further said.

363.title: Wish I could take legal action: Falguni on Neha Kakkar's remake of 'Maine Payal Hai...'
363.article_body: Reacting to singer Neha Kakkar's remake of her 1999 song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai', singer Falguni Pathak said, "I wish I could [take legal action] but the rights are not with me." This comes after Falguni reshared Instagram Stories of fans who criticised Neha's remixed version of the song. A fan had also urged Falguni to sue Neha.

364.title: Not winning a World Cup remains my only regret: Jhulan Goswami
364.article_body: India Women fast bowler Jhulan Goswami, who will play her final international match tomorrow, said that not winning a World Cup remains her only regret. "I have played two World Cup finals but couldn't win the trophy...For every cricketer, it is a dream-come-true moment to win a World Cup," she added.

365.title: Resort receptionist goes missing in U'khand, ex-minister's son arrested for her murder
365.article_body: After a 19-year-old receptionist at former Uttarakhand minister Vinod Arya's son's resort went missing on September 18, three people, including his son have been arrested for her murder. Police said the accused Pulkit Arya had reported Ankita Bhandari missing. The accused have confessed to pushing her into a canal after a personal dispute, following which she drowned, police said.

366.title: Centre denied permission for Europe visit: Punjab Minister Aman Arora
366.article_body: Punjab Minister Aman Arora on Friday alleged he was denied permission by BJP-led central government to travel to Europe. Arora was to travel to Belgium, Netherlands and Germany for knowledge exchange program on new and renewable energy. "My journey was stopped due to political reasons, Centre does not want...Delhi and Punjab governments to solve the problem of pollution," he said.

367.title: Bhuvneshwar neither took wickets upfront nor has been effective at death: Saba
367.article_body: Talking about Bhuvneshwar Kumar's form, Saba Karim said the India pacer has neither picked wickets upfront nor has been effective at death. "They can try Deepak Chahar as he can swing the ball...can even be given three overs upfront before Harshal Patel and Jasprit Bumrah can be used for...latter stages," he added. Bhuvneshwar posted 4-0-52-0 in first T20I against Australia.

368.title: Last 2 yrs, thought every series was my last: Jhulan ahead of her final game
368.article_body: Ahead of her farewell game, Indian pacer Jhulan Goswami said that in the last two years, she thought every series was her "last" one because of "injuries". "After the World Cup...I thought maybe [the] Sri Lanka tour will be my last...but again I got injured in the last match of the WC and...[couldn't] travel to Sri Lanka," Goswami said.

369.title: Bihar will be centre of BJP-mukt Bharat: JD(U) President
369.article_body: JD(U) President Rajiv Ranjan alias Lalan Singh said on Friday that Bihar will become the centre of "BJP-mukt Bharat" (BJP-free India) in the 2024 general elections. Further, he claimed that BJP backstabbed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar during the 2020 Assembly elections. Ranjan was reacting to Home Minister Amit Shah's accusation that Kumar backstabbed BJP by breaking ties with the party.

370.title: Close your eyes, take a wild swing: Akram's advice to Babar on playing spin
370.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram gave some advice to skipper Babar Azam on playing against spin bowling. "I will tell Babar what I used to do when I didn't understand a spinner," Akram said in a video shared by a Pakistani sports channel. He added, "Close your eyes, clear the front foot and take a wild swing towards mid-wicket."

371.title: Former Chinese deputy minister jailed for life over bribery
371.article_body: Former deputy minister of China's Public Security Ministry has been jailed for life by a court for accepting $91 million in bribes, state media reported on Friday. Sun Lijun was expelled from the ruling Communist Party for "damaging the party's unity". Sun's sentencing comes ahead of a party congress where Xi Jinping is expected to be re-elected as China's President.

372.title: Was very nervous on 1st day: Mouni on working with SRK in 'Brahmastra'
372.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy spoke about working with Shah Rukh Khan on the sets of 'Brahmastra' and called her experience "magical". "On...first day, I was very nervous but then...I was telling myself to get over it and let's make this really exciting experience," she added. Mouni further said she feels grateful that she got an opportunity to work with Shah Rukh.

373.title: War crimes committed in Ukraine, UN-mandated probe body says
373.article_body: The UN's Commission of Inquiry on Ukraine has concluded that Russian forces committed war crimes in Ukrainian areas previously held by them, the probe body's chief said on Friday. Atrocities including executions, torture, rape and confinement of children were perpetrated, Erik Mose added. However, no "general pattern" of soldiers using sexual violence as a strategy could be established, Mose said.

374.title: India announce playing XI for 2nd T20I vs Australia, match reduced to 8 overs per side
374.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to field first in the second T20I match against Australia in Nagpur. The match has been reduced to eight overs per side after delay due to wet outfield. Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah returns to Team India's playing XI in place of Umesh Yadav. Further, Rishabh Pant has replaced Bhuvneshwar Kumar.

375.title: TN woman thought to be dead and buried comes back home next day
375.article_body: A 72-year-old Tamil Nadu woman, believed to have died in a train accident, returned home a day after her family buried what were believed to be her remains. The woman's family buried the body of another woman found dead on tracks, wearing a saree similar to hers. The family was in the middle of a ritual when the woman returned.

376.title: I don't read my films' reviews, even when they are good: Alia
376.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said in an interview that she doesn't read her films' reviews. "Even when...reviews are good I don't read them. When they're bad I don't read them," she added. "I try and get feedback for every film on what I could've done better and if...film has worked then what has worked...If it didn't work...then why not?" said Alia.

377.title: Former BSP MLA Ansari sentenced to 5-year jail under Gangster Act
377.article_body: Allahabad High Court sentenced former BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari to five-year imprisonment and imposed a ₹50,000 fine on him under the Gangster Act in a 23-year-old case. The case was lodged in 1999 and a court acquitted Ansari in 2020, which led to the state filing an appeal in 2021. On Wednesday, Ansari was awarded seven-year jail in another case.

378.title: Man calls AIMIM leader wanting to meet Owaisi, carry out blasts
378.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered an FIR after an AIMIM leader received multiple video calls from a man, who allegedly wanted to meet Asaduddin Owaisi and carry out "bomb blasts in India". The man also reportedly sent across his Aadhaar card identifying himself as Ranjit Kumar Sahani, 25, from Bihar. The man was apparently in Hyderabad when he called the leader.

379.title: 10-time TT champion Sharath forced to retire from quarters at National Games
379.article_body: Ten-time table tennis singles champion Sharath Kamal was forced to withdraw from the 36th National Games with a lower back injury in Surat on Friday. The 40-year-old was leading the quarter-final match against Soumyajit Ghosh 7-11, 12-10, 11-8, 6-1. Sharath had won three gold and one silver medals at Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham last month.

380.title: Locals in Kerala's Kannur beat up PFI activists for imposing strike
380.article_body: PFI activists were reportedly beaten up in Kerala's Kannur when they tried to close shops as part of their strike. Locals reacted angrily to a group of PFI supporters and even chased down one of the protestors to hand him over to the police. Other political party members had reportedly joined the local people to take on PFI.

381.title: Scientists engineer mosquitoes that can't spread malaria
381.article_body: Scientists have engineered mosquitoes that cannot spread malaria to humans. They genetically engineered the mosquitoes in a way that they produced compounds which inhibit the growth of malaria-causing parasites in their gut, which in turn, reduces the possibility of these parasites reaching the mosquitoes' salivary glands and being passed on in a bite to humans.

382.title: No plans to give unemployment allowance: UP Labour Minister
382.article_body: UP Labour and Employment Minister Anil Rajbhar said the state has no plans to give unemployment allowance. He was replying to a question raised by BSP leader Umashankar Singh in the Legislative Assembly. Rajbhar added that nearly 25.4 lakh candidates applied to his ministry's employment portal and about 6.7 lakh of them have been selected through employment fairs.

383.title: Tried to do what Aamir Khan does, my kidneys shut down: Fawad on transformation for film
383.article_body: Talking about his physical transformation for 'The Legend of Maula Jatt', Pakistani actor Fawad Khan said he tried to do what Aamir Khan or Christian Bale do. Fawad, who gained around 25 kg for the character, said, "It's not the best thing I did to myself...I'd never do that again...Ten days into it, I was hospitalised. My kidneys shut down."

384.title: India will be one of the favourites to win T20 World Cup: Kallis
384.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Jacques Kallis said India will be undoubtedly one of the favourites to win the T20 World Cup 2022 title. "They're a good sort. In...World Cup, you need luck to go your way and you need to play big moments. Certainly, they do have a chance to win it," he added. World Cup will begin on October 16.

385.title: DMK perpetrating dynastic rule, legitimising corruption: JP Nadda in TN
385.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda, who is on a two-day visit to Tamil Nadu, criticised the ruling DMK and accused the party of perpetrating dynastic rule and also legitimising corruption. "DMK government is playing petty politics in the state," Nadda said. "Letters in the DMK stands for Dynasty, Money swindling and Katta panchayat (kangaroo court)," Nadda added.

386.title: Flights from Ambala to Srinagar & Lucknow soon: Haryana minister
386.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said flights from Ambala to Srinagar and Lucknow will be available for residents of the state soon. Ambala is an Indian Air Force base and the IAF has given a no-objection certificate (NOC) for starting air travel for civilians from its airport, Vij said. The terminal will be built at a cost of ₹40 crore.

387.title: Did Amit Shah come here to 'scare' anyone: Tejashwi Yadav
387.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Friday criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who is on a two-day visit to the state's Seemanchal region, asking if he had come to "scare" anyone. "He's the Home Minister of the country but did it seem so? To me, he neither appeared to be a political leader nor a Home Minister," Yadav said.

388.title: Next inspection for India-Aus T20I at 8:45 pm, cut-off time for 5-over match 9:46 pm
388.article_body: The start to the second India-Australia T20I in Nagpur has been delayed due to wet outfield. The next ground inspection will take place at 8:45 pm, with the cut-off time for a five-over match being 9:46 pm. "It is still soggy. It is not safe for the players and we are still waiting for it to dry," the umpires said.

389.title: UP bans cattle trade with 4 states amid lumpy skin disease threat
389.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has banned cattle trade with four neighbouring states to prevent the spread of lumpy skin disease. State Animal Husbandry Minister Dharam Pal Singh said the disease entered Uttar Pradesh through states like Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Haryana and Delhi. Uttar Pradesh has also imposed a "lockdown" on the intrastate movement of animals from 28 districts, he added.

390.title: Air pollution causes brain damage in children: Study
390.article_body: According to a new study, exposure to air pollution causes brain damage raising the risk of depression, stress and autism in children. The study showed that children who lived near busy roads and were exposed to traffic-related chemicals had abnormal white matter, which is linked to psychiatric problems, including depressive symptoms, anxiety and autism spectrum disorders.

391.title: COVID-19-like virus found in Russian bats, can infect humans & is immune to vaccines
391.article_body: A new virus similar to the COVID-19 virus has been found in Russian bats, a new study has said, adding that it is capable of infecting humans. The study further said that Khosta-2 virus is "resistant to both SARS-CoV-2 monoclonal antibodies and serum from individuals vaccinated for" COVID-19. Khosta-2 attaches to the same protein receptor as the COVID-19 virus.

392.title: Ranbir asks fans to watch 'Vikram Vedha', says 'Please support it'
392.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor visited a theatre in Thane on the occasion of National Cinema Day and thanked the audience for loving his movie 'Brahmastra'. He also urged the fans to watch 'Vikram Vedha' starring Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. "Next week, another good film is releasing, Vikram Vedha. Please support it as well," Ranbir said.

393.title: I see him more as a friend & philosopher: Pratik on co-star Jackie Shroff
393.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi, speaking about his relationship with veteran actor Jackie Shroff, said, "I see him more as a friend and a philosopher." He called Jackie a "very kind, loving and warm person" and added, "He gives a lot of hope to humanity whenever I speak to him." The duo worked together in 'Ventilator' and 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava'.

394.title: Russian minister calls Zelenskyy 'b*****d' & walks out of UN meet amid criticism
394.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Thursday defended Russia's invasion of Ukraine during a meeting of the United Nations Security Council. Lavrov said the US has set its policy toward Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy "on the basis of the principle: 'He might be a b*****d, but he's our b*****d'". He later walked out amid criticism by almost all UNSC members.

395.title: How does average age of India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad compare with other editions?
395.article_body: The average age of India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad is 30.2 years. It's India's oldest squad in the history of the tournament. The average age of India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad was 28.9 years, while it was 28.3 years for the 2016 edition. India's squad for their successful T20 World Cup 2007 campaign was their youngest (23.6 years).

396.title: Cleartrip hijacks this festive season: Cleartrip
396.article_body: Cleartrip shared that for the Big Billion Days sale, it is turning ads into travel offers, where users can scan QR codes on print ads and unlock travel deals at similar or discounted prices. When it comes to spending money on things versus trips, pick Maldives over mobiles, Bikaner over bags and premium hotels over basic products, said Cleartrip.

397.title: UP Assembly passes bill denying anticipatory bail to rape accused
397.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly on Friday passed the Code of Criminal Procedure (Uttar Pradesh Amendment) Bill 2022 which bans granting of anticipatory bail to rape accused. State minister Suresh Kumar Khanna said the provision will deny anticipatory bail to those accused of misconduct against women or children. This will reduce the chances of the accused destroying evidence, he added.

398.title: 3 men throw chilli powder, alcohol at woman's private parts in Pune
398.article_body: Police have arrested a man and launched a probe after a Pune woman alleged three men chased her at his bidding and threw chilli powder and alcohol at her private parts. The woman, who hid in a public toilet, was also attacked with a razor blade. The accused and victim had met on social media and recently had a fallout.

399.title: 2 Liberian officials detained in South Korea for raping teenagers
399.article_body: South Korean police said on Friday that they had detained two Liberian government officials for allegedly raping two teenage girls in South Korea. The men were arrested on the spot at a hotel in the city of Busan on Thursday, police said. South Korea's Foreign Ministry is reviewing whether the accused are entitled to diplomatic immunity, a ministry official said.

400.title: Speaker revokes 228 ad-hoc appointments in Uttarakhand Assembly
400.article_body: Uttarakhand Assembly Speaker Ritu Khanduri Bhushan on Friday revoked 228 ad-hoc appointments made in the Vidhan Sabha Secretariat. This comes after an expert committee detected a violation of norms in these appointments. The revoked appointments include 150 that were made in 2016, six in 2020 and 72 in 2021. Bhushan also placed Vidhan Sabha Secretary Mukesh Singhal under immediate suspension.

401.title: Must increase backward Muslim quota to 8-12%: Owaisi to T'gana govt
401.article_body: Telangana government must increase the backward Muslim quota to 8-12%, MP Asaduddin Owaisi said on Friday. The AIMIM chief added, "The existing 4% reservation is inadequate when compared to the population and socio-economic status of Telangana's Muslims." He cited the Sudhir Commission, which had recommended 12% or a minimum of 9% reservation to the community in social and educational sectors.
